0.title: US mother uses iPhone feature to track car stolen with 9-yr-old son inside it
0.article_body: A US mother helped police locate her car, which was stolen with her nine-year-old son inside, using Apple's 'Find My iPhone' feature. "With the assistance of the victim, officers used 'my location' technology on the child's iPhone and began canvassing the immediate area," police said. The car was located, the suspect was arrested and the child appeared to be uninjured.

1.title: Raj Thackeray booked for wielding sword during rally in Thane
1.article_body: A case has been registered against MNS chief Raj Thackeray, Thane MNS president Avinash Jadhav and party worker Ravindra More for allegedly wielding a sword during the political rally held in Thane on Tuesday. "We filed a case against the three under the Arms Act, Section 4 and Section 25 on Wednesday," an officer from Naupada Police said.

2.title: People who say Kashmir Files divides community should watch it first: Darshan
2.article_body: Darshan Kumaar, reacting to the claims that his film 'The Kashmir Files' was dividing communities, said, "I will request those people to first watch the film and then decide." Darshan stated he has been getting calls from his friends of "different religions" who cry and talk about his performance in it. "They said we brought the truth out," he added.

3.title: Rajinikanth is like a young child, ready to learn: Kushboo Sundar
3.article_body: Speaking about Rajinikanth, actress-politician Kushboo Sundar has said, "He comes across as a very young child, ready to learn...that's his biggest quality...that's what makes him a legend." She further stated working with Rajinikanth after 28 years in the 2021 Tamil film 'Annaatthe' was a "wonderful experience". "What I have seen and known him, he hasn't changed at all," Kushboo added.

4.title: Women's situation in WB similar to Draupadi's 'Cheer Haran': BJP MP
4.article_body: BJP's Roopa Ganguly on Wednesday compared situation of women in Bengal to Draupadi's 'Cheer Haran'. Ganguly, who portrayed Draupadi in 'Mahabharat', added that she felt pain of her character and feels same way for women subjected to atrocities in Bengal. Her comments come amid alleged rape of a 14-year-old girl in Nadia, wherein a TMC leader's son is reportedly involved.

5.title: Winless MI to bowl first against PBKS, Tymal Mills returns to MI's playing XI
5.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against PBKS in their IPL 2022 clash on Wednesday. MI, who are yet to win a match in IPL 2022, have made one change to their playing XI, with Tymal Mills replacing Ramandeep Singh. PBKS, who are seventh on the points table, are playing with an unchanged side.

6.title: 'Picture abhi baaki hai mere dost': Tejasvi Surya after being detained
6.article_body: BJP Yuva Morcha National President Tejasvi Surya after being detained by Rajasthan Police when he tried to visit violence-hit Karauli tweeted, "Picture abhi baaki hai mere dost." Reacting to the step taken by police officials, the BJP MP said, "Section 144 is not in place at where we are now. This dictatorial government is snatching our rights."

7.title: Don't take lunch break for more than 30 mins: CM Yogi to UP officials
7.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has ordered his officials to reach office on time and not take lunch break for more than 30 minutes. He has also asked ministers and officials to stay at government guesthouses instead of hotels during official tours, an official said. They have been asked not to appoint relatives as their personal secretaries.

8.title: Video shows the moment cable cars collided on Jharkhand ropeway
8.article_body: A video shows the moment cable cars collided with each other at Trikut hills close to Baba Baidyanath Temple in Jharkhand's Deoghar district on Sunday. At least three people died and several others were injured due to the accident. The Indian Air Force had conducted a rescue mission at the site.

9.title: Can officially say that Ranbir, Alia make the best-looking pair: Remo
9.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Remo D'souza, who choreographed a part of the song 'Kesariya' in the film 'Brahmastra', said, "Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt have the best chemistry, both on and off-screen." "Now that they are getting married, I can officially say that they make the best-looking pair," he added. Remo further said that it was "beautiful" to shoot with Ranbir and Alia.

10.title: Security for victim's family in Asaram Bapu rape case stepped up
10.article_body: Police have stepped up security for the family of the victim in the 2013 rape case against Asaram Bapu after the victim's father claimed a threat to his family members' lives from Bapu's supporters. The victim's father alleged that a suspected follower of Bapu left a threat letter on March 21, adding that derogatory language was used.

11.title: World Bank slashes India's FY23 GDP forecast from 8.7% to 8%
11.article_body: The World Bank cut its FY23 GDP growth forecast for India from 8.7% to 8%. "High oil and food prices caused by the war in Ukraine will have a strong negative impact on people's real incomes," said World Bank South Asia VP Hartwig Schafer. World Bank has also slashed the growth forecast for South Asia, excluding Afghanistan, to 6.6%.

12.title: Draw of lots for DDA Special Housing Scheme 2021 on Apr 18: Officials
12.article_body: Draw of lots for Delhi Development Authority's (DDA) Special Housing Scheme 2021 is slated to be held on April 18, officials said on Wednesday. The scheme is offering 18,335 flats of different categories that remained "unsold in DDA's previous housing schemes". The draw "will be based on random number generation system" and will be streamed live.

13.title: 24-yr-old soldier records himself raping a baby, arrested in Russia
13.article_body: A 24-year-old Russian soldier, Alexei Bychkov, has been arrested in Russia for allegedly filming himself raping a baby. While it was not known exactly when and where the footage was filmed, some media reports claimed the incident took place in Ukraine. Bychkov also allegedly shared other videos of child abuse with his friends and colleagues.

14.title: Lawyer sent to 14-days judicial custody over protest at Pawar's Mumbai home
14.article_body: A Mumbai court sent advocate Gunaratna Sadavarte to 14-days of judicial custody in connection to the protest by MSRTC employees outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's Mumbai residence last week. Satara Police will take Sadavarte into their custody tomorrow. Reportedly, his wife Jayashree Patil has also been named as an accused for allegedly instigating the protest.

15.title: Liquor hid inside LPG cylinder by cutting its base in Bihar seized; video viral
15.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media that showed liquor hidden inside an LPG cylinder by cutting the cylinder's base into a square shape in Bihar's Patna. A man was arrested for delivering liquor in an LPG cylinder near Kadam Ghat and police seized several litres of liquor. The sale and consumption of liquor are banned in Bihar.

16.title: 10 more children test positive for COVID-19 in Gautam Buddh Nagar
16.article_body: Ten more children tested COVID-19 positive in Gautam Buddh Nagar, taking the total number of minors infected in the district this week to nearly 23, officials said. "We have not got any information from their schools, neither were the COVID-19 tests held [there]," Chief Medical Officer said. On Monday, a school was shut after 13 students tested positive for COVID-19.

17.title: Finland to decide on NATO membership in coming weeks: PM Marin
17.article_body: Finland's PM Sanna Marin said on Wednesday that the country will decide whether it will join NATO in the coming weeks. Marin's comments came as she met her Swedish counterpart Magdalena Andersson in Stockholm to discuss regional security amid the Russian military offensive in Ukraine. Notably, Russia has warned both Finland and Sweden against joining the military alliance.

18.title: Bombay HC denies stay on 'Jersey', film to release on April 22
18.article_body: Bombay High Court has denied a stay on Shahid Kapoor's upcoming film 'Jersey' after the film's makers were accused of plagiarism by writer Rajneesh Jaiswal. Jaiswal had claimed that the movie's script belonged to him. 'Jersey' will be released on April 22. The film is a Hindi remake of the 2019 Telugu film 'Jersey' which starred actor Nani.

19.title: What is the case involving K'taka minister and a contractor's suicide?
19.article_body: Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa is accused of abetting the suicide of a contractor Santhosh Patil. In letters to the Centre, Patil said he and six other contractors invested ₹4 crore for road projects in Belagavi in 2021 but suffered losses due to delay in payments. He accused Eshwarappa and his associates of demanding a 40% commission for clearing the bill.

20.title: Largest comet ever seen in space confirmed; NASA shares pics
20.article_body: NASA's Hubble Space Telescope has confirmed the largest comet nucleus ever seen, stating that the estimated diameter is approximately 80 miles across, making it larger than US' Rhode Island. The mass of comet C/2014 UN271 (Bernardinelli-Bernstein) is estimated to be 500 trillion tons. The previous record holder is comet C/2002 VQ94, with a nucleus estimated to be 60 miles across.

21.title: Nawab Malik's properties, including 5 flats in Mumbai, attached by ED
21.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday said it has attached eight properties linked to jailed Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik and his family in connection to a money laundering case involving Dawood Ibrahim. The attached properties include a unit at Kurla in Mumbai, a 147-acre agricultural land at Osmanabad in Maharashtra, three flats in Kurla and two residential flats in Bandra.

22.title: JMI students stage protest against violence at JNU over non-veg food
22.article_body: Students of Jamia Millia Islamia held a protest at the university's campus on Tuesday to protest against the violence that took place at Jawaharlal Nehru University allegedly over serving non-vegetarian food on Ram Navami. Around 50 students were present at the protest, which was organised by the Students Islamic Organisation of India (SIO), All India Students Association (AISA) and more.

23.title: Mira hugged me & cried for 15 mins after watching 'Jersey': Shahid
23.article_body: Shahid Kapoor has said that his wife Mira Rajput hugged him and cried for 15 minutes after watching his film 'Jersey'. "She was overwhelmed because I was playing a father in the film...After watching the film, Mira understood a lot about me as a person; she could understand my struggles," he stated. "Mira connected with the film deeply," he added.

24.title: Ambedkar Jayanti to be celebrated as 'Day of Equality' in TN: Stalin
24.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin announced on Wednesday that the birth anniversary of BR Ambedkar on April 14 (Ambedkar Jayanti) will be celebrated as the 'Day of Equality' in the state. Stalin added that a full-sized bronze statue of Ambedkar will be erected in Chennai. Additionally, a few of Ambedkar's books will be published after being translated into Tamil.

25.title: We have no work with any Russian client today: Infosys
25.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh, while announcing Infosys Q4 results, said, "We have no work with any Russian client today and we have no plans for any work with any Russian client going ahead." He added, "The work we do is for a few of our global clients that have operations in Russia. We have less than 100 employees in Russia."

26.title: Infosys hired 85,000 freshers last year, to add over 50,000 freshers this year
26.article_body: Infosys CFO Nilanjan Roy said, "In the last year (FY22) we hired 85,000 freshers, both globally and in India." He added, "We are planning to do (hire) upwards of 50,000 freshers at least this year (FY23)...and we will see how that plays out...but that's just initial." He also said, "The good news is...we've mastered the art of off-campus recruitment."

27.title: Suspected canine virus kills all 7 foxes in Ranchi zoo in last 1 month
27.article_body: All seven foxes at Bhagwan Birsa Biological Park in Jharkhand's Ranchi died in last one month, its director Jabbar Singh said, adding that it may be due to canine virus. The first fox died in March first week. "Though we haven't...received any official report from IVRI, [it] verbally hinted that the deaths might be due to [canine virus]," he added.

28.title: Union Minister seeks action plan to rejuvenate B'luru's water bodies
28.article_body: Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar has asked the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike to submit an action plan on rejuvenating the city's existing water bodies. He visited the Kempambudhi, Gubbalala and Mestripalya lakes as part of the initiative to develop 75 'Amrit Sarovars', under which either old lakes will be improved or new ones will be created in each district of India.

29.title: Infosys' employee attrition rate rises to 27.7% in Q4
29.article_body: Infosys announced on Wednesday that its employee attrition rate continued to rise during the January-March 2022 quarter, reaching 27.7%. The attrition rate in Q3 FY22 was 25.5% and in Q4 FY21 was 10.9%. Infosys' employee count increased 20.95% YoY from 2,59,619 to 3,14,015 in Q4 FY22, with a majority of them being software professionals.

30.title: Over 1,000 Ukraine marine troops have surrendered in Mariupol: Russia
30.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry said on Wednesday that 1,026 Ukrainian marine troops have surrendered in port city of Mariupol, which has been besieged by Russian troops for weeks. Among the surrendered troops were 162 officers and 47 women personnel, the ministry further said. Over 10,000 civilians have died in the city since the Russian invasion began, Mariupol's Mayor Vadym Boychenko said.

31.title: Imran Khan to be investigated over sale of gifted necklace for PKR 180 million
31.article_body: After being ousted from the PM's office, Imran Khan faces a central probe for allegedly selling a necklace received as a gift from another nation. Reports said it wasn't sent to the state repository as is custom. It was instead given to special assistant Zulfikar Bukhari, who then sold it to a jeweller, reportedly for PKR 180 million (₹7 crore).

32.title: Jhunjhunwala sells substantial stake in Indiabulls Real Estate
32.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala has sold a substantial portion of his stake in Indiabulls Real Estate Limited. His name is missing from the company's key shareholder's list but the quantum of shares he has sold is not yet clear. According to Indiabulls' Q3 FY22 shareholding data, Jhunjhunwala held five million shares, or a 1.1% stake, in the real estate firm.

33.title: Infosys reports ₹32,276 cr revenue in Q4, net profit at ₹5,686 cr
33.article_body: Infosys reported a 22.67% YoY rise in revenue from operations from ₹26,311 crore to ₹32,276 crore and a 12.01% rise in net profit to ₹5,686 crore in Q4 FY22. Profit in Q3 FY22 was ₹5,809 crore and revenue was ₹31,867 crore. Infosys' financial services segment witnessed the highest revenue in Q4 at ₹10,096 crore, up 16.35% from ₹8,677 crore.

34.title: MI should have played him vs RCB: Sehwag backs Sams despite 35-run over
34.article_body: Ex-Team India opener Virender Sehwag said MI should have played Australian pacer Daniel Sams in their loss against RCB, despite conceding 35 runs in an over in the previous match against KKR. "MI needed him with the bat. When wickets were falling, Sams could have come and...taken MI to a respectable total," added Sehwag. MI will take on PBKS today.

35.title: Will not be indifferent to those who undermine Russia sanctions: US
35.article_body: The US and its allies "will not be indifferent" to those who undermine sanctions they've imposed on Russia over Ukraine war, US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said. Nations seeking advantage by failing to condemn Russia's "heinous war" are being short-sighted, she added. Until Russian President Vladimir Putin ends the war, the US will "work...to push Russia further towards...isolation", she said.

36.title: 7-yr-old Pune boy to have solo exhibition of his paintings in London
36.article_body: Seven-year-old Advait Kolarkar from Pune will have a solo exhibition of his paintings at the Gagliardi Gallery in London from May 12 to 22. "His canvas is covered with motifs such as oceans and dinosaurs," his mother said. His first exhibition was held in Art2Day Gallery, followed by City of Saint John Gallery in Canada and Artexpo New York, USA.

37.title: Won't take body till accused are arrested: Late K'taka contractor's family
37.article_body: Prashant Patil, the brother of contractor Santhosh Patil who allegedly died by suicide in Karnataka, has said the family won't take his body till those named in FIR aren't arrested. "Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa, Basavaraj and Ramesh must be arrested...We want justice," he said. In a purported suicide note, Patil blamed Eshwarappa for his death and demanded punishment for him.

38.title: MacBook maker Quanta suspends ops at China plants amid COVID-19
38.article_body: Taiwan-based MacBook maker Quanta Computer is among the growing list of firms that have suspended operations at some Chinese plants amid the government's measures against COVID-19. Quanta suspended its operations at its Shanghai plant. It said it was in close touch with suppliers and assessing the financial impact. Over 30 firms have suspended their operations.

39.title: 5-yr-old girl raped by 22-yr-old neighbour in Faridabad; absconding
39.article_body: A 5-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her 22-year-old neighbour when she was alone at her home in Faridabad's Pali Crusher Zone, police said on Wednesday. According to the victim's father, the accused forcefully entered their house on Monday and raped her. An FIR has been registered against the accused, said Station House Officer (Dabua Police Station) Inspector Bhagwan.

40.title: India's trade deficit rises 35.7% YoY to $18.51 billion in March 2022
40.article_body: India's merchandise trade deficit in March 2022 rose 35.7% YoY from $13.64 billion to $18.51 billion. While merchandise exports rose 19.76% to $42.22 billion, its imports rose 24.21% to $60.74 billion, data released by the government showed. The overall trade deficit widened to $9.91 billion in March, up 93.93% YoY from $5.11 billion in March 2021.

41.title: Death of all US leaders wouldn't avenge Soleimani killing: Iranian commander
41.article_body: The killing of all American leaders will "still not avenge" Iran's Revolutionary Guards' (IRGC) top commander Qassem Soleimani's killing, a senior Iranian Guards commander Mohammad Pakpour said. "We should avenge him by following Soleimani's path and through other methods," he added. Soleimani was killed in an airstrike in 2020 ordered by then-US President Donald Trump at the Baghdad airport.

42.title: Shilpa Shetty's mother Sunanda granted bail in ₹21L loan default case
42.article_body: Shilpa Shetty's mother Sunanda Shetty has been granted bail on Tuesday in a ₹21 lakh loan default and cheating case. The bailable warrant, which was issued against Sunanda last month, was cancelled by a city court. The complainant had claimed that the loan, reportedly taken by Shilpa's late father in 2015, was to be repaid by January 2017.

43.title: MI need to be ultra-aggressive like CSK to win their 1st game: Graeme Swann
43.article_body: Ahead of MI's game against PBKS, ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann has said the Rohit Sharma-led side needs to be "ultra-aggressive" like CSK was against RCB to register their first win of the IPL season. "MI basically need to take a template from what CSK did...and copy that going forward," he stated. So far, MI are winless in their four games.

44.title: Man booked for making indecent remarks against UP CM Yogi Adityanath
44.article_body: Police have booked a man in UP's Budaun for allegedly making indecent remarks against CM Yogi Adityanath. According to SSP OP Singh, a video had surfaced on social media wherein the man, identified as Mahendra, can be seen making indecent remarks against the CM. An FIR was lodged in this regard based on BJP office-bearer Anuj Saxena's complaint.

45.title: US space firm shares lounge capsule design to be lifted via giant balloon
45.article_body: US-based Space Perspective has shared its design for a tourist lounge capsule that comes with 360-degree panoramic windows and will rise to the edge of space. It shared the interior of Spaceship Neptune, a pressurised capsule that will cruise high above Earth, lifted via a giant balloon. The lounge will have mood lighting, reclining chairs and plants, among other things.

46.title: Johnny Depp's sister testifies in court, says 'Amber called him old, fat man'
46.article_body: Johnny Depp's sister Christi Dembrowski testified in the defamation lawsuit filed by Johnny against his ex-wife Amber Heard. "I've seen...insults, multiple times actually. Amber called Johnny an 'old, fat man'," Christi testified. She recalled Amber being in "disbelief" when Dior wanted to work with Johnny. She stated, "Amber said, 'Dior is about class and style...you [Johnny] don't have style'."

47.title: T20 cricket heading towards where football is, already we're late: Ashwin on retiring out
47.article_body: Referring to himself retiring out against LSG, RR's Ravichandran Ashwin said, "T20, as a sport, is heading towards where football has reached. Just like how they're using substitutions, I did something similar [retiring out]." He added, "Already we're late, but I believe this will happen a lot in the coming days." He further said it was a tactical decision.

48.title: Villagers came in tractors to see 'Big B's son' during Refugee's shoot: Abhishek
48.article_body: Actor Abhishek recalled that several villagers had heard reports of Amitabh Bachchan's son filming and had come to the sets of 'Refugee' in Bhuj, Gujarat, to watch him. "People from...villages came filled in tractors," he said. "Then I started thinking 'Oh they've all come to see Mr Bachchan's son and I'm going to be such an epic failure'," he added.

49.title: US lying about possible chemical attack in Ukraine: Russia
49.article_body: Russia has said that US is spreading lies about a possible chemical attack in Ukraine. "We call on Washington to stop spreading disinformation," said Russian embassy in US. Russia claimed that it had destroyed the last of its chemical weapons in 2017. Meanwhile, Ukraine has said it was looking into the possible use of chemical weapons in Mariupol.

50.title: 13 dead after consuming poisonous mushrooms in Assam
50.article_body: As many as 13 people, including a minor, died across four districts in Assam within a week, allegedly after consuming poisonous mushrooms. All the victims were undergoing treatment at  Assam Medical College and Hospital in Dibrugarh, an official said. "Most of them are from tea garden areas. Many people from...Upper Assam...fall ill after eating poisonous mushrooms every year," he added.

51.title: 'Signal Free Corridor' to make commute to B'luru Airport swifter
51.article_body: The Karnataka government is planning to redevelop the road leading to Bengaluru Airport into a 'Signal Free Corridor', with railway gates and villages nearby, as well as elevating the roads, bridges and underpasses. Around 154 km of Bengaluru will be revamped, which will reduce traffic congestion by at least 20% in the city, reports said.

52.title: US-based Halozyme to buy Antares Pharma in $960 mn all-cash deal
52.article_body: US-based Halozyme Therapeutics will buy specialty pharmaceutical firm Antares Pharma in a $960 million all-cash deal, the companies said on Wednesday. Halozyme will pay $5.6 for each share of Antares Pharma, a premium of 49.7% to the company's last closing price. "The addition of Antares...further strengthens our position as a leading drug delivery company," Halozyme CEO Helen Torley said.

53.title: Google CEO Pichai to co-chair council to help Ukrainian refugees settle in US
53.article_body: Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai will co-chair a new CEO council with over 30 CEOs to help Ukrainians and Afghans resettle in the US. "It builds on Google's long-standing support for immigrants, dreamers and refugees, and will help people through access to technology, jobs and more," Pichai said. The Welcome.US CEO council is co-chaired by Accenture CEO Julie Sweet.

54.title: BJP's Tejasvi Surya, others detained on way to Rajasthan's Karauli
54.article_body: BJP Yuva Morcha chief and MP Tejasvi Surya was on Wednesday detained by Rajasthan Police at Hindaun-Mahwa border as he tried to visit violence-hit Karauli along with others. "Section 144 is not in place at where we are now...It's our constitutional right to go to Karauli," he said. Earlier today, he met victims of the violence at a Jaipur hospital.

55.title: 'Made in India' COVID-19 vaccines better than Pfizer, Moderna: Adar Poonawalla
55.article_body: Covishield maker Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla claimed that "Made in India" COVID-19 vaccines have provided better protection than mRNA vaccines like Pfizer and Moderna. "It's good that...vaccines like...Pfizer and Moderna aren't introduced in India," he said. "In countries like the US, people have taken 2nd and 3rd booster dose and still many are getting infected," he added.

56.title: Played dholak at Rishi, Neetu's wedding; RK weddings have best food: Subhash
56.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai recalled playing the dholak (hand drum) at the wedding of actor-couple Rishi Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor in 1980. He said, "Chintu (Rishi) and Neetu got married in 'RK' style." "Raj Kapoor...used to treat the film industry as a family. The Kapoors are very warm people. RK weddings have the best of food, drinks and music," he added.

57.title: Don’t need to be taught what Hindutva is, it’s in Shiv Sena's blood: Sanjay Raut
57.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that his party does not need to be taught what Hindutva is. "It (Hindutva) is in Shiv Sena's blood. Whenever Hindutva was attacked, at that time, it was not the BJP that came to the forefront. It was us, Balasaheb Thackeray and Uddhav Thackeray," Raut added.

58.title: Request PM to immediately withdraw 'Achhe Din': Kharge on rising inflation
58.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that inflation was at its highest in the last 17 months and asked PM Narendra Modi to withdraw his "Achhe Din" statement. Taking to Twitter, he said, "At 7%, inflation is now highest in 17 months. I humbly request PM to immediately withdraw these 'Achhe Din'. People of India have had enough of 'good times'."

59.title: BJP should change its name to Modi-Shah party: Congress’ Kuldeep Rathore
59.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Kuldeep Singh Rathore said BJP has become a party of two people and it should change its name to "Modi-Shah party". His remark came in reaction to BJP chief JP Nadda’s "Congress is neither Indian nor national" comment. "He should know the history of Congress before making such a remark," Rathore added.

60.title: Halting debt payments will pressurise Sri Lanka's banking sector: Ex-PM
60.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has said that the government's move to temporarily halt foreign debt payments will put additional pressure on country's banking sector amid ongoing economic crisis. He added that the new finance minister should discuss the prevailing situation with International Monetary Fund. Sri Lanka declared on Tuesday that it'll default on its $51 billion external debt.

61.title: Baby monkey hugging dead mother rescued by TN volunteers; IAS officer shares footage
61.article_body: IAS officer Supriya Sahu has shared a video of a baby monkey being fed milk after it was rescued by volunteers at the Besant Memorial Animal Dispensary in Tamil Nadu. "Kudos to volunteers at the Besant Memorial Animal Dispensary for saving this baby monkey who was found hugging her dead mother. Thank you for your service," Sahu tweeted.

62.title: I'm happy Ranbir is getting married; will decide reception details today: Randhir
62.article_body: Speaking about Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, the former's uncle, veteran actor Randhir Kapoor, said, "Ranbir is going to get married but not today. It's around...April 15. I'm...happy [for him]." When asked if there will be a reception, Randhir said, "I'm on my way back (to Mumbai). I was in Goa...So we'll discuss that today and decide."

63.title: Dube got nearly impossible elevation in 102-metre six vs RCB: Manjrekar
63.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said CSK all-rounder Shivam Dube has a natural gift of hitting the ball a long way like Yuvraj Singh. "Josh Hazlewood got it right, bowled it full...Dube was deep inside the crease and to get that kind of elevation, it's almost impossible," added Manjrekar while discussing the all-rounder's 102-metre maximum in the 20th over.

64.title: 5-yr-old tribal girl kidnapped, murdered in Gujarat's Surat, 1 arrested
64.article_body: One person was arrested after a 5-year-old tribal girl was kidnapped and murdered in Punagam area of Surat, Gujarat on Wednesday. According to police, the accused took away the girl while she was asleep. His intention was to commit rape, however, the girl raised an alarm, following which he killed her on the spot, police added.

65.title: SC seeks status report in Haridwar hate speech case from state govt
65.article_body: The Supreme Court has sought a status report from Uttarakhand government regarding the progress in the investigation into the Haridwar hate speech case. During the hearing, counsel appearing for the Uttarakhand government told the apex court that the police registered four FIRs and in three of them, charge sheets have been filed.

66.title: Woman gives birth under mobile phone light in Haryana due to power cut
66.article_body: Following a power cut, a woman had to give birth under the light of mobile phones at a community health centre in Haryana's Alewa on Tuesday. She was taken to the health centre on Monday night as she was in labour, her mother-in-law said. Power failure at the facility causes lot of problems, said the health centre in-charge, Dr Vinod.

67.title: It's between me and my family: Quinton De Kock on decision to quit Test cricket
67.article_body: Opening up on his decision to announce retirement from Tests aged 29, South Africa wicketkeeper-batter Quinton De Kock said, "My reasoning is kept to myself. It's between me and my family." He added, "Obviously, it was a shock to everyone. But I made my decision...It is what it is. Doesn't take away the fact that I still love the game."

68.title: Delhi Transport Minister flags off 80 AC low-floor CNG buses
68.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot on Wednesday flagged off 80 new air-conditioned low-floor CNG buses from Rajghat depot. "Under the guidance of CM Arvind Kejriwal we're committed to making Delhi's public transport service strong," Gahlot tweeted. These buses also have an Intelligent Transport System (ITS) through which all these buses can be monitored on a real-time basis, officials said.

69.title: Willing to talk to protesters: Sri Lankan PM amid economic crisis
69.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa said he's "willing to talk to" the protesters occupying the entrance to the President's office and listen to their ideas for resolving the ongoing economic and political crisis. The protesters camped out for a fifth day demanding the resignation of PM's brother, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, blaming him for the country's worst economic situation in decades.

70.title: Urvashi to make her H'wood debut with 365 Days actor Michele Morrone: Reports
70.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela is all set to make her Hollywood Debut with '365 Days' actor Michele Morrone. According to reports, Urvashi will be seen as a lead in the movie. The working title for the film is 'Renata Fonte', which will be produced by Netflix, Tomasz Mandes and will be directed by '365 Days' director Barbara Bialowas, reports added.

71.title: COVID-19 vaccination centres to be shut in Mumbai on April 14
71.article_body: All government-run COVID-19 vaccination centres will be closed on Thursday, April 14, in Mumbai, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has said. The vaccination will resume on Friday,  April 15. Meanwhile, on Tuesday, Mumbai reported 52 new COVID-19 cases and no deaths. Only one patient was hospitalised yesterday and the recovery rate in Mumbai stands at 98%.

72.title: Google to invest $9.5 billion in US offices, data centres in 2022
72.article_body: Google has announced that it will invest $9.5 billion in US offices and data centres over 2022, up from $7 billion last year. It's expected to create 12,000 new jobs by 2022-end. Google will open a new office in Atlanta. "It might seem counterintuitive to step up our investment in physical offices even as we embrace more flexibility," Google said.

73.title: No funeral till minister is arrested: K'taka contractor's family
73.article_body: The family of the Karnataka contractor Santosh Patil, who allegedly killed himself on Tuesday, has demanded arrest of all the accused in the case, including Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa. "Everybody whose names are mentioned in the FIR must be arrested. We want justice for our brother," said Patil's brother. "We won't conduct the funeral till Eshwarappa is arrested," he added.

74.title: AIMIM leader Akbaruddin Owaisi acquitted in 2 hate speech cases
74.article_body: A Hyderabad court on Wednesday acquitted All India Majlis-E-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) leader Akbaruddin Owaisi in two hate speech cases registered against him. The prosecution failed to produce proper evidence for the same, the court said. It directed Akbaruddin not to make any controversial speeches in future. He had made the alleged hate speeches in Nirmal and Nizamabad in 2012.

75.title: My 1st IPL wicket is one of my favourite batters, I'm happy: CSK's Theekshana
75.article_body: CSK's 21-year-old spinner Maheesh Theekshana picked four wickets while conceding 33 runs in his four overs against RCB. Talking about the match, Theekshana said, "My first IPL wicket is of one of my favourite batters [Faf du Plessis]...I'm really happy." Apart from RCB captain Plessis, Theekshana dismissed Anuj Rawat, Shahbaz Ahmed and Suyash Prabhudessai in the game.

76.title: Russian soldiers gangrape 11-yr-old boy; tied up mother forced to watch in Ukraine
76.article_body: Ukrainian officials have said that Russian soldiers allegedly gangraped an 11-year-old boy and tied up his mother to a chair, forcing her to watch. Ukraine's Parliamentary Commissioner for Human Rights Lyudmila Denisova said the boy was raped in Ukrainian town of Bucha, where several dead civilians showed signs of torture after it was recaptured.

77.title: Heart inflammation after taking COVID-19 vaccination rare: Lancet study
77.article_body: The overall risk of developing myopericarditis (inflammation of the heart muscle) after taking COVID-19 vaccination is very low, a Lancet study has found. The risk of developing the condition was higher for people who received mRNA vaccines with 22.6 cases per million doses than for those who took non-mRNA vaccines with 7.9 cases per million doses, the researchers said.

78.title: Want to correct public perception that JNU is 'tukde-tukde': VC
78.article_body: The Jawaharlal Nehru University Vice-Chancellor, Professor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit, on Wednesday said people have a misconception about the university. "I want to correct the public perception that we are tukde-tukde...after I have taken over I've not seen anybody talking like that," she added. She further said that JNU is as nationalistic as anybody else.

79.title: True words: Zelenskyy after Biden calls Russia's invasion 'genocide'
79.article_body: Reacting to US President Joe Biden labelling Russia's invasion of Ukraine a "genocide", Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said they were "true words of a true leader". "Calling things by their names is essential to stand up to evil," Zelenskyy added. "We're grateful for US assistance provided so far and we urgently need more heavy weapons to prevent...Russian atrocities," he said.

80.title: Oil India's production and drilling unaffected after cyber attack
80.article_body: Oil India Limited (OIL) PRO Tridiv Hazarika said the company's exploration and production work have not been affected in the suspected cyber attack in its field headquarters in Assam's Duliajan. The software handling functions like contractor and vendor payments is also functioning normally. OIL's Duliajan office had witnessed a cyber attack on Sunday which affected a few systems and servers.

81.title: Metro helped passengers save 269 million hrs of travel time in 2021: DMRC
81.article_body: Passengers cumulatively saved a "mammoth 269 million hours of travel time" in 2021 by using Delhi Metro services, the DMRC said on Tuesday. The Delhi Metro also helped "remove over five lakh vehicles from the streets of the national capital daily in 2021. This figure has also increased from about 4.74 lakh in 2019", the statement said.

82.title: TV actress Nikki Sharma deletes all social media posts, writes 'I tried but I am tired'
82.article_body: TV actress Nikki Sharma, who has been a part of shows including 'Sasural Simar Ka' and 'Brahmarakshas 2', recently deleted all her social media posts. She also shared a note on Instagram Stories which read, "I tried but I am tired, I want to be free from my own thoughts now." The actress has reportedly been depressed for some time.

83.title: Video of MS Dhoni plotting Virat Kohli's wicket goes viral
83.article_body: A video of CSK wicketkeeper MS Dhoni plotting RCB batter Virat Kohli's dismissal has gone viral. In the video, Dhoni can be seen moving Shivam Dube from fine leg to deep square leg for Kohli in RCB's fifth over bowled by Mukesh Choudhary. On the next ball, Kohli hit the ball towards deep square leg and was caught by Dube.

84.title: Matter of concern: Chirag on bomb explosion near CM Nitish's 'Jansabha' site
84.article_body: Reacting to the bomb explosion incident near Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's 'Jansabha' in Nalanda district, LJP supremo Chirag Paswan said, "It's a matter of concern and I condemn it." "There is repeated negligence, investigation should be done into the matter. This is the second attack on him within a month," he added. Earlier, a man attacked Nitish Kumar in Bakhtiyarpur.

85.title: Pic shows Hyd policeman giving food to elderly woman lying unconscious on road
85.article_body: A police official of the Hyderabad City Police offered food and water to an elderly woman who was lying unconscious on a road near the Sea World hotel lane. The police also shared a picture that shows the policeman offering idlis to the woman. Police said they had received a complaint that one woman was lying there.

86.title: Won't resign: K'taka minister named in contractor suicide case
86.article_body: Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa, who was named in an FIR after 40-year-old contractor Santhosh Patil died by alleged suicide, said on Wednesday that there's no question of him resigning. In a suicide note, Patil had purportedly blamed Eshwarappa for his step. "The death note is false propaganda," Eshwarappa claimed, adding that he "has seen 100 cases like this".

87.title: Heatwave spell across northwest India ends, Delhi to witness winds: IMD
87.article_body: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the major spell of heatwave across northwest India has come to an end. "Due to the increased presence of clouds over Delhi, Punjab, Rajasthan and Haryana, the temperature will decrease by 2-3°C...Delhi will have wind and cloud conditions," an IMD official said. "Heatwave conditions might arise in Rajasthan around April 16," he added.

88.title: Dolphin attacks trainer forcing it to perform in US; PETA shares video
88.article_body: PETA shared a video of a dolphin attacking a trainer after being allegedly forced to perform tricks for the visitors' entertainment at Miami Seaquarium. "This chilling video shows a dolphin attacking a trainer, tossing her body violently through the water, & reportedly sending her to the hospital," tweeted PETA. "Miami Seaquarium must send the animals to seaside sanctuaries," PETA added.

89.title: We gave dharna in Delhi but anti-farmer Centre didn't pay heed: TRS MLC
89.article_body: Telangana produces 40% of India's rice, TRS MLC K Kalvakuntla said on Wednesday. "That's why we're called the rice bowl of India," Kalvakuntla added. "Since production is so high, we require help from the Central government. We gave dharna in Delhi but the corporate-friendly and anti-farmer Central government didn't pay heed to it," Kalvakuntla stated.

90.title: Sri Lanka urges citizens living abroad to send money amid economic crisis
90.article_body: Sri Lanka has urged its citizens living abroad to donate money amid the economic crisis the country is going through. Central bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe asked them to "support the country at this crucial juncture". He said the bank "assures that such foreign currency transfers will be utilised only for importation of essentials, including food, fuel and medicines".

91.title: Superiority of son over father; it's a dream of every dad: Big B on Abhishek
91.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan praised his son, actor Abhishek Bachchan, post the release of his film 'Dasvi'. He said Abhishek has given him "so much pride and joy". Sharing an article on Instagram featuring Abhishek, Amitabh wrote, "Every father's dream...My prayers [are always] with you." He also took to his blog and wrote, "The superiority of...son over the father...Biggest moment of pride."

92.title: Prashanth's concern was my health after cancer, mine was 'Adheera': Sanjay
92.article_body: Sanjay Dutt said he was concerned only about his character 'Adheera' in upcoming film 'K.G.F: Chapter 2', after making a comeback having been diagnosed with cancer during the movie's production. Sanjay added that the film's director Prashanth Neel was concerned about his health. "While the journey has been challenging, I have loved every part of it," stated Sanjay.

93.title: Deutsche Telekom buys $2.4 billion SoftBank stake in T-Mobile
93.article_body: Deutsche Telekom AG has bought SoftBank Group's stake in T-Mobile US for $2.4 billion. It now holds 48.4% of the company. Deutsche Telekom bought 21.2 million shares at an average price of $113 per T-Mobile share. In September last year, SoftBank agreed to swap about 45 million T-Mobile shares for a 4.5% stake in Deutsche Telekom AG.

94.title: 7 sentenced to life over toddler’s kidnapping in 2014 in Mumbai
94.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai sentenced seven people to life imprisonment for kidnapping a three-year-old boy and taking a ransom of ₹81 lakh from his father in 2014. They were only arrested a year later for kidnapping a 21-year-old and demanding ₹2 crore ransom. Court held the accused guilty of kidnapping for ransom, extortion, wrongful confinement and criminal conspiracy.

95.title: PMRDA files complaints against 6 builders for selling illegal plots
95.article_body: Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) has filed police complaints against six builders for selling illegal plots to people. "Before purchasing...plots in the PMRDA region, citizens must check the legalities instead of blocking their money," an official said. PMRDA also appealed to residents to reach out to the authority if they have information on illegal plotting in the region.

96.title: 3 members of family shot at over pet dog's bark in UP's Ghaziabad
96.article_body: Three members of a family were shot at by a group of men after the victims' pet dog barked at them in UP's Ghaziabad, police said. "All victims suffered gunshot injuries...[were] rushed to Delhi's GTB Hospital," police added. "On Monday night, the dog barked at the suspects again...in a fit of rage, they brought firearms...shot at the victims," police stated.

97.title: 19-yr-old girl caught with pistol in her pocket; video shows UP police recovering it
97.article_body: A 19-year-old girl was caught with a country-made pistol in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri. A video of the incident is being widely circulated online, showing a policewoman recovering the weapon from her pocket. While several reports claimed that the accused was a teacher, Mainpuri Police clarified that she is not a teacher and the case is under investigation.

98.title: Akash Deep will be the trump card for RCB at the backend of IPL 2022: Hogg
98.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg has said RCB pacer Akash Deep will be the franchise's trump card with the ball at the backend of the ongoing IPL season. "Akash, with his extra height and bounce, is going to improve...I like the way he swings the ball away from the left-handers...He'll be the final tick in the box for RCB," added Hogg.

99.title: Journalist arrested in Pune over protests outside Sharad Pawar's home
99.article_body: A journalist has been arrested from Pune in connection with the protest by MSRTC employees outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's home in Mumbai. A group of MSRTC employees had staged a protest outside Pawar's residence on April 8, accusing him of not doing anything to help them. At least 115 people have been arrested in the matter so far.

100.title: Will not allow imposition of Hindi in Tamil Nadu: BJP's Annamalai
100.article_body: Days after Amit Shah's Hindi speaking remark, Tamil Nadu BJP leader K Annamalai said that the state unit of the party will not allow the imposition of Hindi in the state. "If we require for work, education or other purposes, we can learn Hindi but it cannot be imposed. None of us here, including me, speaks Hindi," Annamalai said.

101.title: Asking senior actors to audition is humiliating, really hurts: Sudhaa Chandran
101.article_body: Actress Sudhaa Chandran said asking senior actors like her to audition is humiliating and really hurts, adding that she openly refuses to audition. "If I have to audition then what is my 35 years of input in this industry, and if you don't know my calibre, well I don't want to work with you," stated Sudhaa.

102.title: There's so much fear: Suchitra on her mother comparing actors to prostitutes
102.article_body: Discussing her novel 'Drama Queen' where she mentioned how her mother was against her acting in films and going on to compare actors to prostitutes, Suchitra Krishnamoorthi said there's so much fear about the sexuality, confidence of girls. Suchitra further discussed in the book about her sister being criticised for standing at a bus stop as "only prostitutes loiter there".

103.title: 'Runway 34' shot with 14-15 cameras which nobody in B'wood has done: Ajay
103.article_body: Discussing his upcoming film 'Runway 34', actor Ajay Devgn said the movie had scenes which were shot using 14 to 15 cameras which nobody in Bollywood has done before. "It was pretty tough to shoot. The first decision we took was to make a genuine...cockpit. The size of a cockpit is small. Two people barely fit in," added Ajay.

104.title: Went to 'Donda' premiere having not spoken to Kanye for 8 months: Kim
104.article_body: Talking about her former husband and rapper Kanye West, Kim Kardashian said she attended the premiere of Kanye's album 'Donda', having earlier not spoken to him for eight months at the beginning of their divorce. Kim filed for divorce from Kanye in February 2021. Kanye is reportedly looking for "behavioural treatment" to "be a better human".

105.title: 60 kg fake gold seized in Assam; 1 arrested
105.article_body: Assam Police said they seized 60 kg fake gold from a person driving a four-wheeler vehicle during a security check at NH 15 on Tuesday. The police chased the vehicle and arrested the driver who tried to escape. "The police team chased the vehicle…During the search, we recovered 60 kg of fake gold from the vehicle," said police.

106.title: Anjuman-I-Islam members offer pooja at Dharwad's Hanumantha temple
106.article_body: Members of the educational and social organisation, Anjuman-I-Islam, offered a special pooja at the Sri Nuggikeri Hanumantha temple in Dharwad on Monday. This came after the members of Sri Ram Sene allegedly vandalised at least four fruit carts belonging to Muslim vendors near the temple on Saturday. Karnataka Police have made four arrests in the case so far.

107.title: Johnny Depp smiles as ex-wife's lawyer tells court 'Depp is obsessed with Musk'
107.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp smirked in the court as his ex-wife Amber Heard's lawyer said, "You'll find out that Depp is obsessed with Elon Musk." Actress Amber Heard, who filed for divorce with Depp in 2016, later dated Elon Musk. Depp sued Heard for defamation over her article on domestic violence, claiming that it implied Depp was an "abuser".

108.title: 17 Eklavya schools to be functional in Tripura by 2023-24: Union Minister
108.article_body: Union Minister Bishweswar Tudu on Tuesday said altogether 17 Eklavya Model Residential Schools would be made functional in Tripura by 2023-24 academic session. The state currently has four such educational institutes. "PM Narendra Modi has been laying emphasis on proper education for tribal youths as he believes only better learning can bring a change among them," Tudu added.

109.title: 1 killed as drunk driver rams car into pedestrians in Mumbai
109.article_body: A drunk driver, identified as Mukesh Pradeep Singh, rammed his car into pedestrians near the World Trade Centre in Mumbai's Cuffe Parade on Tuesday afternoon, allegedly killing one senior clerk working with the Navi Mumbai Police Commissionerate. After dropping off his employer, the accused took the car for a joyride, said police. He was arrested soon after the incident.

110.title: Over 42,000 displaced after tropical typhoon hits Philippines
110.article_body: More than 42,000 people have been displaced after Typhoon Megi made landfall on Sunday in the Philippines. Typhoon Megi had triggered landslides in coastal provinces, leaving at least 56 people dead and dozens of others missing. Notably, Megi is the first tropical cyclone to hit the country this year, which sees an average of 20 such storms annually.

111.title: Rohit must forget captaincy when he bats, needs to know he's 'Hitman': Sehwag
111.article_body: Ahead of MI's game against PBKS on Wednesday, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said MI will have to "put extra runs on board" as CSK did against RCB to earn their first win in the ongoing IPL season. "Rohit Sharma will need to forget [captaincy] when he walks out to bat and needs to know that he's the 'Hitman'," added Sehwag.

112.title: Dharavi has recorded no new COVID-19 cases since Mar 24: BMC data
112.article_body: Asia's largest slum Dharavi has recorded no new COVID-19 cases since March 24, data collated by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) showed. With a population of 8.5 lakh residents, Dharavi has recorded 8,652 cases and 419 deaths due to COVID-19 since April 1, 2020. The G/North ward, which covers Dharavi, Dadar and Mahim areas, currently has only one active case.

113.title: Actions by state govts amid incidents of violence 'inappropriate': Mayawati
113.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday said state governments' actions in Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat and Rajasthan amid recent cases of violence were 'inappropriate'. Mayawati tweeted that the incidents disturbed peace and harmony, adding, "The actions initiated by (the state) governments prima facie seem to be revengeful." "Will such examples lead to a new India?" she further wrote.

114.title: Do it like the rich do: dezerv.
114.article_body: Wealthtech firm dezerv. claims to help you invest like the ultra-wealthy have been investing for decades. Their experts aim to curate high-performing portfolios to maximize your wealth. dezerv. also offers its members exclusive access to benefits like pre-IPO deals and plans to offer global equity deals soon. It’s time to use the strategies of the ultra-wealthy for yourself, said dezerv.

115.title: I refused to remove my turban: Minister Puri as he shares 2010 US airport incident
115.article_body: On the occasion of International Turban Day or Sikh Dastar Diwas on Wednesday, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri recalled an old incident at a US airport. "I refused to remove my Dastar (turban) or let anyone touch it at a US airport in 2010 leading to the current practice of self-pat check by Sikhs at international airports," he tweeted.

116.title: PMC begins sealing illegal structures during anti-encroachment drives
116.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has begun sealing illegal structures as it continues conducting anti-encroachment drives in city, PMC's anti-encroachment department head Madhav Jagtap said. "Every day...[anti-encroachment] drive goes on at five to six...locations in different ward offices," he added. Jagtap also appealed to residents to remove encroachments themselves instead of awaiting action.

117.title: Major fire breaks out at BSNL office in Pune, doused in nearly 2 hrs
117.article_body: A major fire broke out on the eight floor of the BSNL office in Pune Cantonment area around 1 am on Tuesday. Tables, chairs, sofas and computers were gutted in the blaze, an official said, adding that firemen had to break open glass window panes to get inside the building. The blaze was doused by 2.30 am.

118.title: Police warn media not to block cars as guests arrive for Ranbir-Alia's mehendi
118.article_body: Mumbai Police officials were seen issuing strict instructions to photographers not to block the cars for photos as guests arrived for Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's mehendi ceremony, reported Times of India. They were asked to wait for whichever star wanted to give them a photo. Ayan Mukerji, Kareena Kapoor and Karisma Kapoor were seen arriving for the ceremony.

119.title: 2 drunk policemen breach IPL bio-bubble to click pictures with players
119.article_body: Two police constables, deputed for security at the DY Patil Stadium, breached the bio-bubble to click pictures with players during the IPL 2022 match between Gujarat Titans and SunRisers Hyderabad. The duo sneaked into the bio-bubble after arguing with the women constables. Both of them have been booked under section 85(1) of Maharashtra Prohibition Act.

120.title: Bharti documents baby's homecoming in a new video; reveals nickname
120.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh, who welcomed a son with her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa on April 3, shared a new video about the baby on their YouTube channel Lol (Life of Limbachiyaa's). She also shared a glimpse of the baby's welcome to their home and revealed the nickname she and Haarsh gave him. She said, "We call him Golla because he's golu-molu."

121.title: Mumbai-Ahmedabad Bullet Train project to start operations by 2027
121.article_body: National High Speed Rail Corporation Managing Director Satish Agnihotri said services for the public on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad High Speed Rail corridor will be rolled out in 2027. However, the trial run on the corridor's Gujarat section will begin in 2026. He said the Surat station, which will be one of the largest bullet train stations, will be completed by 2023.

122.title: Viral video shows ground suddenly collapsing with 5 men and a bike falling inside
122.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing the ground suddenly collapsing with five men and a bike falling inside. The incident purportedly happened at a roadside mechanic shop in Rajasthan. Four of the five men were talking to each other, while a mechanic was repairing the bike when the ground suddenly caved in.

123.title: 'Secret weapon' Hasaranga not bowling till 11th over blunder by RCB: Hogg
123.article_body: Discussing RCB's defeat against CSK, ex-KKR spinner Brad Hogg tweeted that RCB made a mistake by not making their "secret weapon" Wanindu Hasaranga bowl his first over till the 11th over. "CSK [were] tactically superior. They bowled seven overs of spin in the first 10 overs compared to three from RCB," added Hogg in his tweet.

124.title: What an incredible answer: Paytm CEO on MEA Jaishankar's remark on Russia
124.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to laud the MEA S Jaishankar for his response to a reporter, who had asked, "Why not condemn Russia's invasion (of Ukraine)?" Jaishankar responded, "I prefer to do it my way and articulate it my way...We've made statements...We're against the conflict." Sharing Jaishankar's response, the Paytm CEO tweeted, "What an incredible answer."

125.title: I really liked it: PM Modi on graph with sound of money transacted via UPI
125.article_body: India in Pixels shared a graph with the sound of money transacted via UPI from October 2016 to March 2022 through data sonification on Twitter. PM Narendra Modi said, "I've spoken about UPI and Digital Payments quite often but I really liked how you've used the sound of money transacted...to effectively convey the point. Very interesting, impressive and obviously informative!"

126.title: Senior BJP leader Harmel Dhiman, 2 others from Himachal join AAP
126.article_body: National Executive Member of BJP and Vice-President of BJP's Himachal Pradesh SC Morcha, Harmel Dhiman on Wednesday joined the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in presence of Satyendar Jain. Along with Dhiman, two other BJP leaders from Himachal Pradesh, Devraj and Jagdish Pawar also joined AAP. "At least 1,000 people from BJP will join AAP soon," Jain said.

127.title: Bird appears to poop on US President Biden during his inflation speech; video viral
127.article_body: A bird appeared to poop on US President Joe Biden's suit as he delivered his speech on inflation and the state of the American economy in Iowa. A video of the incident, which is going viral on social media, shows a white substance falling on him while he was unveiling plans to cut gas prices.

128.title: Case filed against Digvijaya Singh for his tweet on Khargone violence
128.article_body: A case was filed against Congress leader Digvijaya Singh for allegedly spreading religious animosity by tweeting a fake photo related to a violence incident in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone. Singh shared an image of young teenagers waving a saffron flag at a mosque, referring to the violence that erupted during a Ram Navami procession in Khargone. Later, he removed the tweet.

129.title: Caregiver for Sonam's mother-in-law stole ₹2.4 crore cash, jewellery: Police
129.article_body: A caregiver for actress Sonam Kapoor's mother-in-law stole cash and jewellery worth ₹2.4 crore from their Delhi residence. The caregiver and her husband have been arrested by the police over the theft that took place on February 11. The stolen jewellery and cash are yet to be recovered, according to reports.

130.title: Arshad Warsi to undergo surgery for kidney stone; advised complete rest: Reports
130.article_body: Actor Arshad Warsi will reportedly undergo surgery at a hospital in Mumbai on Wednesday. According to reports, Arshad is currently resting in a suburban multi-speciality hospital near his home and will have a kidney stone operation on April 13. He has been advised complete rest, medication and monitored diet and water consumption for the next fortnight, reports added.

131.title: ST panel orders Keonjhar Collector’s arrest for ignoring summons
131.article_body: The National Commission for Scheduled Tribes issued an arrest warrant against Odisha’s Keonjhar district Collector, Ashish Thakare, for "ignoring" summons for a hearing on violations of tribal rights. It has asked state police chief to produce Thakare on Wednesday before the panel as he “absconds and keeps out of the way for purpose of avoiding service of the summons".

132.title: Indian Consulate in Shanghai to be 'inaccessible' due to COVID lockdown
132.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Beijing said Indian Consulate in Shanghai will remain "inaccessible" and will not be in a position to provide in-person consular services amid COVID-19 lockdown in the Chinese city. However, the consulate will remain operational in remote mode. Indians in eastern China have been advised to approach the Embassy of India in Beijing for emergency consular services.

133.title: 1 dead, 6 injured after speeding car hits multiple vehicles in Gr Noida
133.article_body: While one person was killed, six others including a three-year-old kid were injured after a rashly driven cab hit a car followed by a bike in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida. The 32-year-old man, who was riding the bike with his son and wife, succumbed to the injuries. A pedestrian and an ice cream vendor were also injured in the accident.

134.title: Suyash came to bat in a tough situation, looked like he belonged: RCB's Hesson
134.article_body: RCB's Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson praised batter Suyash Prabhudessai for his performance against CSK on Tuesday night. "He came in a tough situation and looked like he belonged. That's what you want to see from these young guys," stated Hesson. Suyash came in to bat when RCB were 50/4 during the seventh over and scored 34 off 18.

135.title: Ex-Zoho staff's startup Securden raises $10.5 mn led by Tiger Global
135.article_body: IT security firm ﻿Securden﻿ has raised $10.5 million in a Series A funding round led by Tiger Global. The investment round has also seen participation from Together Fund and Securden's existing investor, Accel. Founded by former Zoho employees Bala Venkatramani and Kumaran Balan, Securden offers access security and governance platform for IT services, DevOps, and cloud environments.

136.title: Pune's SPPU to schedule papers for students who missed semester exams
136.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has decided to hold papers for students who have missed their semester exams. Students can apply for exams between April 8 and April 18 and colleges have been asked to inward these forms from April 19 to April 20. According to SPPU's examination department, over six lakh students are appearing for the second-semester examination.

137.title: Boat carrying rice bags sinks in Assam's Brahmaputra river
137.article_body: A boat carrying rice bags reportedly sank in the Brahmaputra river after it was caught up in a storm in Assam's Barpeta district on Tuesday. "Passengers were rescued, but the rice bags and other items were damaged," a local said. "We demand from the state government to take necessary steps to construct a bridge connecting Bohori to Kachumara," he added.

138.title: Neetu shares pic from her engagement with Rishi Kapoor ahead of Alia-Ranbir's wedding
138.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a picture from her engagement with Rishi Kapoor ahead of her son Ranbir Kapoor's wedding with Alia Bhatt. "Fond memories of Baisakhi day...as we got engaged 43 years back on 13th April 1979," Neetu wrote. Neetu and Rishi had got married on January 22, 1980. Rishi passed away aged 67 in 2020.

139.title: Zelenskyy offers to swap captured Putin ally for Ukrainian 'boys & girls'
139.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has proposed swapping captured pro-Russian politician Viktor Medvedchuk, seen as President Vladimir Putin's closest ally in the country, for Ukrainian "boys and girls who're held in Russian captivity". Earlier, Zelenskyy had posted a picture on Facebook of Medvedchuk, who escaped from house arrest after Russia's invasion, in a military uniform and handcuffs.

140.title: Delhi HC grants bail to 8 accused of vandalism outside Kejriwal's home
140.article_body: Delhi High Court granted bail to eight people who were arrested in connection with vandalism and violence outside CM Arvind Kejriwal's home. The evidence collected, so far, is of such nature that they cannot tamper with it, HC stated. "The continued custody of the applicants is not called for only because some investigations are still going on," it added.

141.title: Dhoni helped me improve; asked me to stay still, let the skill work: Dube
141.article_body: Discussing his unbeaten 95 off 46 balls against RCB, CSK all-rounder Shivam Dube said MS Dhoni helped him improve his game, adding that Dhoni asked him to stay still and let his skill work. Dube helped CSK set a target of 217 for RCB. Defending champions CSK beat RCB by 23 runs and recorded their maiden win in IPL 2022.

142.title: You can rape Ukrainian women, just use protection: Russia woman to soldier partner
142.article_body: In a phone call intercepted by Ukrainian security services, a Russian woman is heard telling her soldier partner to rape Ukrainian women amid the war. "Don't tell me anything, understand...Just use protection," the woman said. "Wives of Russian aggressors call on their husbands to rape Ukrainian women," Ukrainian security services wrote along with the audio clip.

143.title: Bundesliga match paused for the first time ever to allow a player to break Ramadan fast
143.article_body: A match between Mainz and Augsburg was paused in the 65th minute, marking the first instance of a Bundesliga match being briefly halted to allow a player to break fast during Ramadan. Referee Matthias Jollenbeck halted proceedings so that Mainz defender Moussa Niakhate ​could hydrate himself. Moussa then thanked the referee for his gesture.

144.title: Mumbai woman falls for 'buy 1 get 2' ad on Facebook, gets cheated of ₹1 lakh
144.article_body: A 59-year-old Mumbai-based woman lost ₹1 lakh after ordering a product after seeing a Facebook ad that read "buy one thali and get two thali free". The woman called on the mobile number mentioned in the advertisement. Later, the fraudster sent her a link asking to share bank details. On sharing the details, the amount was deducted from her account.

145.title: Madrid knock out Chelsea, Villarreal beat Bayern to enter Champions League semis
145.article_body: Real Madrid knocked out Chelsea while Villarreal eliminated Bayern Munich in their respective quarterfinal ties to advance to the Champions League semifinals. Madrid, who had won the first leg 3-1, advanced with a 5-4 aggregate win despite suffering a 2-3 defeat in second leg. Villarreal earned a 1-1 draw in the second leg after having won the first leg 1-0.

146.title: PM Modi pays tribute to the martyrs of Jallianwala Bagh massacre
146.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to the people martyred in the Jallianwala Bagh massacre in 1919. "Their unparalleled courage and sacrifice will keep motivating the coming generations," he tweeted on Wednesday. Hundreds of people who had gathered at the Jallianwala Bagh to protest peacefully against the Rowlatt Act were gunned down by the British forces on April 13, 1919.

147.title: Mumbai man creates 11 fake profiles to sexually harass wife over triple talaq FIR
147.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly creating 11 fake profiles on Instagram to sexually harass his wife after she lodged an FIR against him for giving her triple talaq last year. The 30-year-old complainant told the police that she started getting sexually explicit messages from unknown Instagram accounts on her and her daughter's Instagram handle.

148.title: Kapiva claims their Get Slim Juice is deemed effective on 90% of users
148.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda shared in a study conducted amongst its Get Slim Juice consumers that 90% of users claimed it helped in weight loss, reduced cravings, and improved energy levels. Kapiva claims that it has 12 ayurvedic herbs which effectively boost metabolism and reduce fat accumulation and sugar absorption. Kapiva also provided doctor guidance to consumers to manage weight.

149.title: BJP chief JP Nadda forms team to look into Hanskhali rape-murder
149.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda has reportedly formed a five-member committee to look into the alleged gangrape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in West Bengal's Hanskhali. The committee, which includes MP Rekha Verma and UP minister Baby Rani Maurya, has been asked to submit its report at the earliest. Earlier, the Calcutta High Court ordered CBI to investigate the case.

150.title: Sex with minor is rape: Mahua Moitra after Mamata Banerjee's 'love affair' remark
150.article_body: Speaking on the alleged rape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in West Bengal, TMC MP Mahua Moitra said sex with a minor is rape and a crime. She said, "I won't tolerate such things." This comes after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's remark, "How do you know if she was raped or was pregnant or had a love affair?"

151.title: Sikh youth attacks 2 with kirpan at Delhi's Kamla Nagar Market, 1 dies
151.article_body: A Sikh youth, identified as Gurpreet Singh, attacked two persons with a kirpan at Delhi's Kamla Nagar Market area on Tuesday, police said. One of the victims died on the spot, while the other faced serious injuries, police added. Singh reached the area to acquire money from one of the victims following which a fight broke out between the two.

152.title: Uber halts surge pricing following Brooklyn shooting after criticism
152.article_body: Uber and Lyft halted surge pricing in the Sunset Park area of Brooklyn after their algorithms increased fares in the wake of a shooting on April 12. Ride fares increased on the apps after emergency alerts advised people to avoid the area near the 36th Street subway station. The firms faced criticism online for the surge pricing on apps.

153.title: Don't give Raj Thackeray so much importance: Ajit Pawar amid Azaan row
153.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said he will soon reply to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's warning about removal of loudspeakers from mosques. "Raj Thackeray must not be given so much importance, when...right time comes, I'll surely answer on it," Pawar said on Wednesday. Thackeray warned against statewide protests if the government fails to remove loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

154.title: I resented playing 'Arya Stark' in 'Game of Thrones': Maisie Williams
154.article_body: Actress Maisie Williams, who portrayed the character of 'Arya Stark' in television series 'Game of Thrones', said she resented playing 'Arya', as she couldn't express who she was becoming when she started becoming a woman. "I also resented my body because it wasn't aligned with the piece of me that the world celebrated," added Maisie.

155.title: Alia-Ranbir's wedding happening on April 14, definitely not on April 20: Robin Bhatt
155.article_body: Talking about Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's wedding, Alia's uncle Robin Bhatt said, "As far as I know...their wedding is happening on April 14 as scheduled. It’s definitely not on April 20." He stated, "I don’t know why it’s being done quietly. It was Ranbir and Alia’s call. It’s an unusual marriage because the children are taking all the decisions."

156.title: IPO-bound Pine Labs makes majority investment in Mosambee
156.article_body: IPO-bound Pine Labs has made a significant majority investment into payments solution provider Mosambee. With the investment by Pine Labs, Mosambee is now valued at upwards of $100 million, the company said. The leadership team at Mosambee will continue to operate independently. Pine Labs had raised $50 million from London-based international investment firm Vitruvian Partners in March.

157.title: Karthik really struggled at KKR: Ex-Team India manager Lalchand Rajput
157.article_body: Ex-Team India manager Lalchand Rajput said RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik really struggled while representing KKR and could not execute his skills. "Karthik is surely the best finisher...[currently]," added Rajput. Karthik has scored 131 runs in five IPL 2022 matches at a strike rate of 218.33 and average of 131. Karthik is RCB's second-highest run-scorer in IPL 2022.

158.title: CGST team raids gutkha trader's house in Himachal, recovers crores in cash
158.article_body: A Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST) department team from UP's Kanpur raided the house of a gutkha trader in Sumerpur in Himachal Pradesh's Hamirpur on Tuesday and recovered crores in cash and gold. The team also brought three note-counting machines from SBI bank. The CGST team seized all the documents, bank accounts and laptops of the trader.

159.title: 2 Sikh men attacked in US, their turbans removed as video shows 1 man bleeding
159.article_body: A person has been arrested after two Sikh men were attacked in Richmond Hill, New York. A video on social media showed the two men without turbans, with one of them seen bleeding. The attack reportedly took place at the same location where a 70-year-old Sikh man was attacked and was left with a broken nose.

160.title: 7 get life term for kidnapping 3-yr-old, taking ₹81 lakh ransom in Maha
160.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai sentenced seven people, including a woman, to life imprisonment for kidnapping a three-year-old boy and taking a ransom of ₹81 lakh from his father in 2014. Court held the accused guilty of kidnapping for ransom, extortion, wrongful confinement and criminal conspiracy. They had remained untraced until they were nabbed in another kidnapping case in 2015.

161.title: I cannot imagine any other Indian actor in Bheem's role: Rajamouli on Jr NTR
161.article_body: When asked if Ram Charan stole the limelight in 'RRR', filmmaker SS Rajamouli said that Ram Charan and Jr NTR justified their respective roles equally. "It breaks my heart to think of crediting one of them for the movie's success," Rajamouli said. "I cannot imagine any other Indian actor in Bheem's role, because it has a multilayered idiosyncrasy," he added.

162.title: Pandemic isn’t over yet, haven’t let guard down: Mansukh Mandaviya
162.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said that the government has not let the guard down and it is continuing tracing, surveillance and genome mapping to see if there’s any new COVID-19 variant. He urged the people to continue with precautions as the pandemic is not over yet. "We cannot predict tomorrow," Mandaviya stated.

163.title: Varavara Rao denied permanent bail, interim relief extended
163.article_body: Poet and activist Varavara Rao, accused in the Elgar Parishad case, was denied a permanent medical bail by the Bombay High Court. The court, however, extended his interim bail by three months to allow him to undergo cataract surgery. Citing his medical condition and high expenses in Mumbai, Rao had sought permission to move to his residence in Hyderabad.

164.title: Flesh trade racket busted in Himachal's Kangra, 5 women rescued
164.article_body: Himachal Pradesh police busted a flesh trade racket and rescued five women allegedly held captive at a private hotel in Kangra's Damtal. The hotel owner and his two sons were also arrested by the police. The police busted the racket after receiving a call from parents of a 27-year-old woman who alleged to have been locked in the hotel room.

165.title: I stand by what I did: De Kock on refusing to take a knee in T20 WC 2021
165.article_body: Talking about refusing to take a knee for 'Black Lives Matter' movement in T20 World Cup 2021, South Africa wicketkeeper-batter Quinton De Kock said he stands by what he did. "[Cricket South Africa] could've done things differently, not just smack dab in the middle of a World Cup...before a game. The pressure was thrown onto the players," added De Kock.

166.title: Centre negating federalism: AAP to SC in plea for control over services in Delhi
166.article_body: The Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government told Supreme Court that Centre has been "negating federalism" by taking away its power. A "democratically elected government" should not be left without powers to even transfer officials, the party said. The statement was made while the apex court was hearing case between Centre and AAP on issue over the bureaucracy in the national capital.

167.title: I've learnt a lot from RCB seniors: Suyash Prabhudessai on 34(18) vs CSK
167.article_body: Speaking at the post-match conference, RCB's 24-year-old batter Suyash Prabhudessai, who made his IPL debut against CSK and scored 34(18), said he has learnt a lot from seniors at the franchise. "I keep interacting with Virat (Kohli) bhai, DK (Dinesh Karthik)...My intent is very clear when I get out to bat, and I back my strengths," he added.

168.title: Ashneer Grover row is an aberration: BharatPe Chairman Kumar
168.article_body: BharatPe Chairman Rajnish Kumar in an interview with CNBC-TV18 said the Ashneer Grover controversy of BharatPe is an "aberration". "The startup universe is very different. When it is in a growth phase, it is possible that the kind of governance which is expected is not there...The media should not pay so much attention to BharatPe," Kumar said.

169.title: 28 hospitalised after consuming sedative-laced drink at Gurugram fair
169.article_body: At least 28 people, including children, were hospitalised after allegedly consuming a sedative-laced drink at a fair in Mubarikpur village in Haryana's Gurugram on Tuesday, police said. The accused offered people the drink claiming it is 'prasad', police added. "The suspect offered them 'Frooty' which was allegedly laced with some intoxicant...28 were taken to civil hospital," police stated.

170.title: Bengaluru man accused of raping, killing 2-year-old ends life in prison
170.article_body: A 31-year-old Bengaluru man, who was on undertrial for being accused of raping, killing his 2-year-old niece, ended life inside Karnataka's Central Jail at Parappana Agrahara. The man was reportedly found dead in bathroom and a blanket was found around his neck, which was tied to window grill. The man was a truck driver and father of two young girls.

171.title: Excise department clerk arrested for taking ₹5,000 bribe in Pune
171.article_body: A 45-year-old state excise department clerk in Pune has been arrested by the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) for allegedly accepting a bribe of ₹5,000 from a businessman seeking a liquor licence for a permit room. The businessman had approached the Anti-Corruption Bureau after the clerk demanded the bribe. Following this, ACB laid a trap and arrested the accused.

172.title: 90 SpiceJet pilots barred from flying Boeing 737 Max, will undergo re-training: DGCA
172.article_body: Indian aviation regulator DGCA has barred 90 SpiceJet pilots from operating Boeing 737 Max aircraft after finding them not properly trained. "They will have to undergo training again," said DGCA Director-General Arun Kumar. SpiceJet said the restriction does not impact the operations of Max aircraft as it still has 560 trained pilots for its fleet of 11 Max aircraft.

173.title: University of Hyderabad orders inquiry after Ram temple built on campus
173.article_body: University of Hyderabad ordered an inquiry after a Ram temple was allegedly built on the campus on the occasion of Ram Navami. It was Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad activists who painted a rock structure and installed photos of Lord Ram and flags, the students' union alleged. "It's a small structure that has existed since the university's inception," the registrar said.

174.title: Germany may snub PM Modi as G-7 guest over India's Russia stand: Report
