174.article_body: Germany is debating whether to invite PM Narendra Modi to G-7 summit over India's stand on Russia's war in Ukraine, according to a report quoting people familiar with the matter. One of the people said India had been on a list drawn up before the war in Ukraine started. Recently, India abstained from a vote to suspend Russia from UNHRC.

175.title: Actor Gottfried, voice of Iago in 'Aladdin', dies at 67 due to ventricular tachycardia
175.article_body: Actor-comedian Gilbert Gottfried, who is known for voicing Iago in Disney's animated film 'Aladdin', passed away aged 67 due to ventricular tachycardia. Gottfried started performing stand-up comedy aged 15. He was a cast member on 'Saturday Night Live' during the 1980-81 season. Gottfried is survived by his wife and their two children, 14-year-old daughter Lily and 12-year-old son Max.

176.title: Mohammed Siraj pulls off Dhoni-like helicopter shot in front of Dhoni, video goes viral
176.article_body: RCB fast bowler Mohammed Siraj pulled off an MS Dhoni-like helicopter shot in front of the CSK wicketkeeper during their IPL 2022 match on Tuesday. Playing the last ball of the match, Siraj executed the helicopter shot and scored a boundary on the bowling of Dwayne Bravo. Siraj scored an unbeaten 14 off 11 deliveries in the match.

177.title: Agra Police arrests man wanted for firing at girl in her house
177.article_body: The Agra Police arrested a man, who was wanted for attacking a girl inside her house on April 1 after she rejected his marriage proposal. "He struck the girl on her head and then fired twice at her. One of the bullets struck the stomach of the girl...She has recovered now," a police official said.

178.title: I'm so happy Ranbir & Alia are together; they are very similar: Imtiaz
178.article_body: When asked about actors Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, filmmaker Imtiaz Ali said, "Amongst the actors that I've worked with, there's no one more similar than Ranbir and Alia. To be alike as actors, you have to be alike as people as well." "The fact that Ranbir and Alia are together, gives me immense happiness and pleasure," he added.

179.title: Dhananjay Munde hospitalised, Ajit Pawar says he didn't have 'minor attack'
179.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar met state's Social Justice Minister Dhananjay Munde, who was admitted to a hospital in Mumbai on Tuesday. Contrary to reports of Munde suffering a stroke, Pawar said, "There's no need to worry. He didn't have a minor attack." He further said that Munde fainted as he became unconscious and was immediately taken to hospital.

180.title: One of the world’s largest hacker forums taken down in global operation
180.article_body: Law enforcement in Europe and US on Tuesday announced the takedown and seizure of an illegal online market that bought and sold access to databases of millions of credit card numbers and other sensitive information belonging to people around the world. The alleged administrator of RaidForums and two other people were arrested in the global operation dubbed Tourniquet.

181.title: Viagra pills, inflatable penis implants purchased by Brazil military for soldiers
181.article_body: The Brazilian military purchased 35,000 Viagra pills and inflatable penis implants for soldiers, according to Congressman Elias Vaz, who said he had been informed through a freedom of information request. The Brazil Defence Ministry said in a statement the pills were in fact "to treat patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension," or high blood pressure in the lungs.

182.title: Impossible to isolate a vast country as Russia: Putin
182.article_body: Russia doesn't intend to be isolated and that doing so would be impossible, said President Vladimir Putin during his visit to Vostochny Cosmodrome spaceport. "It is impossible to severely isolate anyone in the modern world, especially such a vast country as Russia," said Putin. "We will work with those of our partners who want to cooperate," he added.

183.title: Loudspeakers at mosques should be shut by May 3: Raj Thackeray
183.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Tuesday reiterated his call to remove loudspeakers at mosques. "Loudspeakers at mosques should be shut by May 3rd otherwise, we will play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers," Thackeray added. "I want to tell the state government, we will not go back on this subject, do whatever you want to do," Thackeray stated.

184.title: Bihar govt to auction all unused bridges after 60-foot bridge stolen in Rohtas
184.article_body: Bihar government has decided to identify and auction all unused iron bridges as scrap. Commenting on the estimated number of unused bridges, Bihar Water Resources Minister Sanjay Kumar Jha said, "Our engineers are assessing it." This comes days after thieves, posing as officers of the State Irrigation Department, dismantled and stole a 60-foot iron bridge in Rohtas district.

185.title: Millions of lives at stake: UN warns of famine in Somalia
185.article_body: In a joint statement, multiple UN agencies on Tuesday warned of an impending famine owing to prolonged drought in Somalia that could impact millions. "We are literally about to start taking food from the hungry to feed the starving," said an official of UN World Food Programme. "Millions of lives are at stake," added the official.

186.title: Pollard still adds value, I even felt Rohit might give captaincy to him: Manjrekar
186.article_body: Talking about Kieron Pollard's form in the ongoing IPL season, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said the 34-year-old all-rounder still adds value to MI. "I even felt Rohit Sharma might leave captaincy like Virat Kohli, relax a bit...hand the responsibility to Pollard who is a brilliant international captain," Manjrekar added. Pollard has scored 47 runs in his four innings this season.

187.title: Lmao: Hailey on a video claiming there's trouble in her marriage with Justin
187.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber reacted to the rumours saying there's trouble in her marriage with her husband, singer Justin Bieber. Recently, A TikTok video made some predictions about celebrities and among them, there was a claim that things "may be on rocks" with couple Justin Bieber and Hailey. Reacting to the video, Hailey just laughed off the rumours and commented, "Lmaooo."

188.title: No place for riots, chaos in UP: Adityanath on Ram Navami celebration
188.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said that the state had set an example on Ram Navami by demonstrating that "there is no place for riots and chaos" in UP. "Forget about riots and ruckus, there was not even any tu-tu main (argument) during the celebration," he added.  "This is a proof of UP's new progressive way of thinking," Adityanath further said.

189.title: Centre to provide 1.5 lakh free Doordarshan Dish TV services in J&K
189.article_body: The Centre has decided to provide 1.5 lakh free Doordarshan Dish TV services to residents living in areas of Jammu and Kashmir where cable service is not available, the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting said. "The tendering for that is under process...will be completed soon," it added. The Information and Broadcasting Secretary Apurva Chandra was on a visit to J&K.

190.title: Gurugram reports over 100 new COVID-19 cases in single day after a month
190.article_body: Gurugram on Tuesday reported 129 new COVID-19 cases, crossing 100 cases in a single day after over a month, health officials said. Notably, the district had last reported more than 100 cases on March 4, with 115 cases recorded on the day. According to the health department, Gurugram's positivity rate now stands at 8.5% with 384 active COVID-19 cases.

191.title: Pune hospital's licence to perform organ transplants suspended for 6 months
191.article_body: The state health department has suspended the licence of Pune's Ruby Hall Clinic to perform organ transplants for six months. The suspension came after alleged malpractice wherein a woman posing as the wife of a man, who needed a transplant, donated her kidney to a young woman patient. In turn, the young woman's mother donated her kidney to the man.

192.title: Russia war a genocide, trying to wipe out Ukraine: US Prez Biden
192.article_body: US President Joe Biden, for the first time, on Tuesday said that Russia's invasion of Ukraine amounts to "genocide". "Yes, I called it genocide because it has become clearer and clearer that [Russian President] Vladimir Putin is just trying to wipe out the idea of being able to be Ukrainian and the evidence is mounting," Biden added.

193.title: Man arrested for delivering liquor in LPG cylinder in Bihar's Patna
193.article_body: A man was arrested for delivering liquor in an LPG cylinder in Bihar's Patna, officials said on Tuesday. Acting on a tip-off, the police raided the spot near Kadam Ghat and arrested the accused, identified as Bhushan Rai. Police also seized about 50 litres of liquor stored inside the cylinder by cutting its base part into a square shape.

194.title: Gal Gadot, Justin Bieber, Bruce Willis invest in crypto firm MoonPay
194.article_body: Cryptocurrency payments startup MoonPay has raised $87 million from over 60 investors including Justin Bieber, tennis player Maria Sharapova, Bruce Willis and Gal Gadot. The investments are part of the firm's Series A round, disclosed in November last year, which valued the company at $3.4 billion. Over 600 crypto startups have reportedly seen over $12.5 billion in funding this year.

195.title: Special survey conducted in Ambala to check crimes, anti-social activities
195.article_body: The Ambala Police conducted a special survey in Deha Colony from 5 am to 7 am on Tuesday, to identify people indulging in anti-social activities, check crimes and maintain law and order in the area. The survey was conducted under the orders of the Additional Director General of Police (ADGP), Ambala, Shrikant Jadhav.

196.title: Woman held for manhandling security officer to meet Haryana CIC
196.article_body: A woman was arrested after she forcibly tried to enter the office of the Haryana Chief Information Commissioner (CIC), Vijai Vardhan, in Chandigarh’s Sector 8-C by manhandling his personal security officer. According to the police, the woman insisted on meeting Vardhan. She was unable to present any ID proof and on being stopped she manhandled the security officer.

197.title: Don't want to step out, I need Sahab so desperately in my life: Saira Banu on Dilip Kumar
197.article_body: Talking about being "extremely distressed" after the death of her husband, actor Dilip Kumar, veteran actress Saira Banu said, "I cannot get out of the loss." She added, "I don't want to step out....I need Sahab so desperately in my life." She further said, "I am not mingling with people. Maybe only with my immediate friends."

198.title: Man suspected to have shot dead 21-year-old Indian student Kartik in Canada arrested
198.article_body: A 39-year-old man, who is believed to have shot and killed 21-year-old Indian student Kartik Vasudev in Canada, has been arrested. Police identified the suspect as Richard Jonathan Edwin, who was charged with another murder on Saturday. Vasudev's father expressed concern over the motive of the killing not being known and said he would travel to Canada for legal proceedings.

199.title: Russia to launch lunar probe with Belarus this year: Putin
199.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said Russia will launch a space probe with Belarus later this year and deepen cooperation on space infrastructure and technology. Russia will launch a probe called Luna-25 to the Moon in the third quarter of this year, he said. Putin has also asked Russia's Roscosmos to train a Belarusian for flight on a Russian spacecraft.

200.title: States must carry out safety audit of ropeways: MHA after Jharkhand accident
200.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) on Tuesday issued an advisory to the states directing them to prepare maintenance manual for ropeway projects in wake of Jharkhand's ropeway accident in which three people were killed. "The state government must engage an experienced and qualified firm or organisation for carrying out safety audit of each ropeway project," the advisory read.

201.title: UK PM Boris Johnson pays fine, apologises for ‘partygate’
201.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson said he had paid the fine imposed on him in what has been called as the "partygate" scandal, for breaching COVID-19 guidelines. "I have paid the fine and I once again offer a full apology," he said. Johnson had attended his birthday party at Downing Street in June 2020, violating COVID-19 curbs.

202.title: Hindu temple destroyed in South Africa flood
202.article_body: A Hindu temple, estimated to be around 70 years old, was destroyed in South Africa's Durban due to severe flood situation in the city that has left at least 45 people dead. "The deities in our Vishnu temple are still there but in the mother temple, everything is gone," said an official of the temple committee.

203.title: Ukrainian politician who says Putin is godfather to his daughter arrested
203.article_body: Ukraine has said it has arrested pro-Russian politician Viktor Medvedchuk, seen as President Vladimir Putin's closest ally in the country. Medvedchuk, who says President Putin is godfather to his daughter, had been under house arrest in the capital Kyiv on suspicion of treason. He escaped soon after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

204.title: Gold worth ₹26 lakh seized from man's trousers & underwear at B'luru airport
204.article_body: The customs officials at the Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru detected and seized 541.3 grams of gold worth around ₹26.7 lakh from a male passenger. The passenger, wearing trousers and briefs stitched with gold paste bands, had arrived at the airport from Dubai on April 7. The accused has been booked for smuggling and customs duty invasion.

205.title: Legendary: Samantha Prabhu compliments Rihanna's Vogue pregnancy shoot
205.article_body: Samantha Prabhu complimented singer Rihanna's pregnancy shoot. Taking to Instagram, Samantha shared a clip from Rihanna's pregnancy photoshoot for Vogue where she is seen donning several outfits as she poses for the camera. Sharing the post, Samantha wrote, "Legendary." Speaking with Vogue, Rihanna had said, "I'm hoping...we were able to redefine what's considered 'decent' for pregnant women."

206.title: Toxic heavy metals found in groundwater in Delhi: Survey
206.article_body: Heavy metals like manganese, iron and uranium, beyond their permissible limits, have been found in groundwater of some areas in Delhi, including Najafgarh, Nangli Rajpura, Bhalswa, Ujwa etc. Drinking this water, in the long run, can lead to chronic toxicity, impacting kidneys or intestines, experts warned. Using this water occasionally for bathing is, however, largely harmless, the experts added.

207.title: Unfortunate: NCW Chairperson on Mamata's remark on Nadia rape case
207.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) Chairperson Rekha Sharma criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee for her "rape or love affair" comment on the alleged rape of a 14-year-old girl in Nadia. "Her statement over the incident is very unfortunate. Being a woman, she should understand the pain of another woman. She pointed fingers at the victim," Sharma said.

208.title: Musk sued by Twitter investor over delay in disclosing Twitter stake
208.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has been sued by a Twitter investor who claims Musk's delay in disclosing his ownership of over 5% of Twitter artificially kept its share price down. The delay allowed Musk to buy more shares at a lower price, the suit alleges. Musk was required to disclose his then 5% stake by March 24.

209.title: AAP lacks leadership, I do not see it as threat to BJP: Himachal Pradesh CM
209.article_body: Ahead of Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, CM Jairam Thakur said he does not see AAP as a threat to BJP because it neither has leadership nor organisational network on the ground. "They benefitted from Punjab’s political circumstances…Himachal is a different ballgame. Here, the basic character of politics has long been dominated by two parties, BJP and Congress," Thakur added.

210.title: Gunshots fired at liquor businessman's residence in Gurugram's Pataudi
210.article_body: Multiple gunshots were allegedly fired by unidentified assailants at a liquor businessman's residence in Gurugram's Pataudi on Tuesday, police said. The complainant alleged he received a call from an international number and later a voice message, in which they threatened him and demanded a 50% share in his business. Notably, the complainant is the chairman of the Pataudi Municipal Committee.

211.title: I felt it was time to take him on: Uthappa on smashing Maxwell for 18 runs
211.article_body: CSK batter Robin Uthappa, who scored 88 runs off 50 balls against RCB, has said that when all-rounder Glenn Maxwell was bowling his third over in the game he felt it was time to take him on. Uthappa smashed three sixes in that over, with Shivam Dube taking a single. Maxwell had conceded 10 runs in his first two overs.

212.title: Andrew McDonald appointed Australia head coach on four-year deal
212.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Andrew McDonald has been appointed head coach of the Australia's men's team on a four-year deal. McDonald had been the team's assistant coach since 2019. After former head coach Justin Langer's departure on February 5, McDonald was elevated to the position of interim coach while Cricket Australia searched for a suitable full-time candidate.

213.title: Brazil military bought Viagra pills, inflatable penis implants for soldiers
213.article_body: The Brazilian military purchased Viagra pills and inflatable penis implants for soldiers, according to Congressman Elias Vaz, who said he had been informed through a freedom of information request. The Brazil Defence Ministry said in a statement the pills were in fact "to treat patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension," or high blood pressure in the lungs.

214.title: Dhoni skips celebration to console Mukesh for dropping catches, fans react
214.article_body: After CSK dismissed RCB's Shahbaz Ahmed in the 15th over, CSK wicketkeeper MS Dhoni skipped the celebration to console 25-year-old Mukesh Choudhary for dropping two catches in the 12th and 15th over, respectively. "Top leadership quality," a fan commented. "Great to see Dhoni put an arm around Mukesh after that wicket," wrote another. CSK defeated RCB by 23 runs.

215.title: 1,088 new COVID-19 cases, 26 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours
215.article_body: India has reported 1,088 new COVID-19 cases, 1,081 recoveries and 26 more deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 796 COVID-19 cases and 19 deaths. India's active caseload currently stands at 10,870, while the death toll reached 5,21,736.

216.title: Jadeja lies on the ground after taking Karthik's catch, celebration goes viral
216.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja's celebration after taking RCB's Dinesh Karthik's catch near the boundary rope has gone viral. Jadeja intentionally fell on the ground and lied on it to celebrate the wicket. Karthik was dismissed for 34(14) on the bowling of Dwayne Bravo in the 18th over. Reacting to Jadeja's celebration, a fan tweeted, "What a relief."

217.title: Pune woman kills 2 stray dogs after her son gets bitten by one of them
217.article_body: Police have booked a woman for allegedly killing two stray dogs in a residential society in Pune's Hadapsar after one of the dogs reportedly bit her son. The woman allegedly beat the dogs to death with a stick between the night of April 8 and the morning of April 9. "The body of one dog has been found," police said.

218.title: FIR against K'taka Minister KS Eshwarappa, 2 aides in contractor death case
218.article_body: An FIR has been registered against BJP leader and Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa and two of his aides after contractor Santosh Patil, who had accused the minister of corruption, died by suicide. "Udupi Police registered the FIR on the basis of a complaint filed last night by the contractor's family...minister has been booked...for abetment to suicide," a police official said.

219.title: Journalists critical of Indian govt were physically harassed by officials: US report
219.article_body: The 2021 Country Report on Human Rights Practices released by the US State Department has said that government officials at both the local and national levels in India were involved in "intimidating" critical media outlets through physical harassment and attacks. NGOs in India alleged criminal prosecutions and investigations were used to intimidate journalists critical of the government, it added.

220.title: If I feel I can hit, I'm hitting that delivery: Shivam Dube on his form in IPL 2022
220.article_body: CSK all-rounder Shivam Dube, who has become the second-highest scorer in the ongoing IPL season, has said he's only trying to play his natural game. "The ball I feel I can hit, I'm hitting that delivery...Whatever I was trying to do for a long time, I'm...able to execute that now," he stated. Dube scored 95* off 46 balls against RCB.

221.title: HC orders CBI probe into minor’s rape-murder in Bengal's Hanskhali
221.article_body: The Calcutta High Court has ordered the CBI to take over the investigation into the alleged gangrape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in West Bengal's Hanskhali. The court told the agency to submit a status report by May 2 when the case will be heard next. Notably, CM Mamata Banerjee had accused the Opposition of politicising the incident.

222.title: No NOC needed from housing society to sell or rent flat in Mumbai: Maha Min
222.article_body: Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad said that no prior permission from housing society will be needed by owner to sell or rent out their flat in Mumbai. Mumbai is a cosmopolitan city and if a flat owner is not allowed to sell or rent their flat to a particular caste, creed and religion, it would hurt city's image, Awhad said.

223.title: House made under PM Awas Yojana among those demolished in Khargone
223.article_body: A house reportedly built under the PM Awas Yojana was reduced to rubble during the MP government's demolition drive in Khargone following communal clashes. The documents the Muslim family showed to prove ownership included a property tax receipt and a letter from CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan congratulating them on being a beneficiary of the PM's housing scheme.

224.title: Tears were rolling down my face: Jennifer Lopez on her engagement with Ben
224.article_body: Speaking about her engagement with Ben Affleck, singer Jennifer Lopez said they got a second chance at love. "[I]...looked in his eyes smiling and crying at the same time trying...to get my head around the fact that after 20 years this was happening all over again," she added. "Tears were coming down my face, [I was] feeling...incredibly happy," Jennifer said.

225.title: YouTube services restored after global outage
225.article_body: YouTube said it has fixed issues that disrupted users' ability to log in and switch accounts, among other things, globally, adding that the services are now back online. Logging in, switching accounts and using the navigation bar were among the issues faced by users. Users had also reported issues with accessing the live television platform YouTube TV, according to Downdetector.

226.title: More than 150 vendors fined for violating anti-tobacco rules in Noida
226.article_body: The District Tobacco Control Cell (DTCC) fined 153 vendors on Tuesday for violating Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (Cotpa), 2003 in Noida. The fines were issued in Sector 125-126 where one private university and three private schools are located. Few students aged above 18 years were also fined for smoking in public, Dr Shweta Khurana, District Consultant (DTCC) said.

227.title: Fire breaks out in the forest area of Andhra Pradesh's Tirumala
227.article_body: A fire broke out in the forest region of Andhra Pradesh's Tirumala around 2:30 pm on Tuesday, fire officials confirmed. "Fire spread rapidly in the forest area near Elephant Arch on First Ghat Road," an official said. "Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) forest department personnel reached the spot and it took around 8 hours to douse the fire," he added.

228.title: BJP MLA booked for 'provocative speech' during Ram Navami in Hyderabad
228.article_body: Hyderabad Police booked BJP MLA from Goshamahal T Raja Singh for allegedly making a "provocative speech" during a Ram Navami procession. During the rally, Singh purportedly said UP CM Yogi Adityanath will use a bulldozer to clean the country. "The speech and the song...had contents that could likely create enmity between different religious communities," ACP (Goshamahal) R Sathish Kumar said.

229.title: Harshal has ability to stop the game, we missed that vs CSK: Plessis
229.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis said that they missed pacer Harshal Patel in their match against CSK on Tuesday night. "Harshal has got the ability to really stop the game. We missed that...Even towards the end, we lacked variety. Big miss for us," he stated. Harshal left the IPL bio-bubble on Sunday following the death of his sister.

230.title: Over 21 kg of marijuana worth ₹10 lakh seized in Bengaluru, 2 held
230.article_body: Police have arrested two drug peddlers in Bengaluru and seized 21.35 kg of marijuana worth ₹10 lakh from them. The men, both aged 22, were reportedly waiting on a scooter for their clients to deliver the narcotic when the police confronted them. The accused confessed to the police that they procured the drugs from their contacts in Andhra Pradesh.

231.title: Students can now pursue 2 full-time degrees at the same time
231.article_body: The UGC has announced that students will now be able to pursue two full-time academic programmes. Students will be able to pursue two UG or PG degrees/diplomas together in the physical+physical mode or physical+online mode or online+online mode. MPhil and PhD programmes will not fall under the same scheme.

232.title: It's my 1st ever victory as captain, I dedicate it to my wife: Jadeja on win vs RCB
232.article_body: After CSK defeated RCB to register their first win in IPL 2022, CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said, "It is my first ever victory as captain, I would like to dedicate it to my wife because first victory is always special." He added, "CSK management doesn't put pressure on me, they are relaxed, they always come to me and motivate me."

233.title: Woman's 'Not getting married till RCB wins IPL trophy' poster goes viral
233.article_body: A picture of a woman carrying 'Not getting married till RCB wins IPL trophy' poster during Royal Challengers Bangalore-Chennai Super Kings IPL 2022 match has gone viral. Reacting to the picture, a fan commented, "I really hope this is the year for you." RCB have finished as runners-up in IPL three times (2009, 2011 and 2016).

234.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Kathputli Colony, 30 shanties gutted
234.article_body: At least 30 shanties were gutted after a fire broke out at a transit camp in Delhi's Kathputli Colony on Tuesday afternoon. "We got information about the fire at 2.12 pm. It started at the transit camp in Anand Parbat's Kathputli Colony...operation to control the blaze ended at 4 pm," an official said. No casualties were reported in the incident.

235.title: Person of interest identified in US subway train attack, pics released
235.article_body: New York police say they have identified a person of interest in the Brooklyn subway train attack that left more than 20 people injured. Police said they were looking for Frank R James, 62, in connection with the attack. Being identified as a person of interest means police believe he may have information concerning the crime.

236.title: Drinking water for all in Mumbai from May 1: Aaditya Thackeray
236.article_body: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Tuesday said every resident of Mumbai, including those living in slums or buildings without an occupation certificate (OC), will have access to drinking water from May 1. Thackeray said this wouldn't change the legal status of a house. "This will also eradicate the illegal connections that disrupt and pollute our water supply," he added.

237.title: Defending champs CSK record their 1st win in IPL 2022, end RCB's 3-match winning streak
237.article_body: Defending champions CSK defeated RCB by 23 runs to record their first win in IPL 2022 after having lost four matches in a row. With the win, CSK ended RCB's three-match winning streak. The match witnessed CSK record the highest total (216/4) in IPL 2022 so far. RCB were restricted to 193/9 in their 20 overs.

238.title: World Bank is preparing $1.5 bn aid package for Ukraine: Official
238.article_body: The World Bank is preparing a nearly $1.5 billion aid package for Ukraine to support the continuation of essential government services, its President David Malpass said. The World Bank is also planning to provide aid to developing countries struggling to keep up with surging food and energy prices, he added. The spike in food prices needs immediate attention, he claimed.

239.title: Davidovich Fokina beats world no. 1 Djokovic at Monte Carlo Masters
239.article_body: Alejandro Davidovich Fokina on Tuesday beat world number one Novak Djokovic 6-3, 6-7(5), 6-1 in the second round of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. The defeat is Djokovic's first loss in the opening match of a tournament since the Barcelona Open in 2018. Davidovich Fokina will face either Daniel Evans or David Goffin in the third round.

240.title: Wanindu Hasaranga is a trump card for RCB: Lalchand Rajput
240.article_body: Calling Wanindu Hasaranga a "smart bowler", ex-India cricketer Lalchand Rajput said the spinner is a "trump card" for RCB. "He...is very shrewd and...not afraid of getting hit. If you look at his bowling, he always tries to buy wickets, which is...skill of a leg-spinner," he added. With ten wickets from five matches, Hasaranga is currently the leading wicket-taker for RCB.

241.title: 18-year-old accepted into 27 colleges in US, offered scholarships worth ₹30 cr
241.article_body: An 18-year-old student from US' Florida has been accepted into 27 top colleges in the country, including Harvard and Yale Universities, as well as the University of Pennsylvania. Jonathan Walker has been offered scholarships worth a total of $4 million (₹30.44 crore), reports said. Walker said he earned college credits through the International Baccalaureate Program.

242.title: Ravindra Jadeja's firing celebration after Maxwell's wicket goes viral
242.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain Ravindra Jadeja's firing celebration after taking the wicket of Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) all-rounder Glenn Maxwell in their IPL 2022 match has gone viral. Jadeja clean bowled Maxwell for 26(11) on the fifth delivery of RCB's seventh over. After taking the wicket, Jadeja made a gesture of firing with his left hand.

243.title: Malaysian sultan buys painting showing apes, frogs in parliament; pic surfaces
243.article_body: Sultan Sharafuddin Idris Shah Alhaj, the Sultan of Malaysia's richest state Selangor, purchased a painting of apes and frogs filling the benches of the country's parliament. This comes amid the government's delay over the proposed anti-party hopping law. "His Majesty agreed to buy the painting and hang it in his 'private study room'," an Instagram post by his office said.

244.title: Nearly 5 million Ukrainian children have fled their homes: UNICEF
244.article_body: UNICEF warned that about 4.8 million Ukrainian children have been forced to flee their homes since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. UNICEF's Emergency Programmes Director Manuel Fontaine said the death of 142 children, killed mostly by crossfire or explosions, has been confirmed. "In just six weeks, nearly two-thirds of all Ukrainian children have been displaced," he said.

245.title: Russia warns Sweden, Finland against NATO membership
245.article_body: Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov on Monday warned Sweden and Finland against joining NATO amid reports that both Nordic countries are looking to join the military alliance. Further expansion of NATO would "not bring stability to the European continent", Peskov added. "If they decide to apply, I expect that all allies will welcome them," NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said.

246.title: Ukraine stopped Russian hackers from damaging electricity grid: Govt
246.article_body: The Ukrainian government on Tuesday said that it had prevented Russian military hackers from damaging Ukraine's electricity grid with a cyberattack last week. Ukraine has been under steady Russian cyberattack for the past eight years, a top Ukrainian cybersecurity official said. The attacks have tripled since the invasion when compared with the same period last year, the official added.

247.title: John taught me how to ride a bike during 'Dhoom' shoot: Abhishek
247.article_body:
Abhishek Bachchan said John Abraham taught him how to ride a bike during the shoot of their 2004 movie 'Dhoom'. "My mother and my father never allowed me to ride because they were scared...John used to ride with me and teach me. He was unbelievable," he stated. "John said 
'baba, just remember. You have to be very responsible'," Abhishek added.

248.title: Sepp Blatter, Michel Platini to face FIFA corruption trial in June
248.article_body: Former FIFA President Sepp Blatter and former UEFA President Michel Platini will stand trial in a Swiss court over corruption allegations in June. Blatter, 86, and Platini, 66, were indicted on charges of fraud in November including a $2 million payment from FIFA to Platini in 2011. Blatter resigned in 2015 followed by Platini in 2016. Both deny the allegations.

249.title: 300 new One-Stop Centres to open for violence-hit women: Irani
249.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday said that the government plans to open additional One-Stop Centres (OSCs) to provide support to women affected by violence in private or public spaces, family, community, or at the workplace. Irani said that in collaboration with Women's Helplines, about 70 lakh women have been helped by the Central and state governments so far.

250.title: Viral video shows 20 electric scooters on fire in Maharashtra
250.article_body: A video showing around 20 electric scooters of Jitendra EV on fire in Maharashtra's Nashik is going viral on social media. The video shows fire department officials trying to douse the fire in the container truck that was transporting around 40 scooters. The exact cause of fire is yet to be ascertained by the authorities.

251.title: Air India plane damaged as tow tractor collides with it at Delhi airport
251.article_body: A Guwahati-bound Air India plane was damaged after a tow tractor collided with its nose while pushing it back for take-off at the Delhi airport on Tuesday, senior DGCA officials said. No one was injured in the incident and the 182-seater aircraft was grounded for inspection. Aviation regulator DGCA has initiated an investigation into the incident, officials added.

252.title: People seen lying on ground and bleeding after being shot at Brooklyn station
252.article_body: After mass shooting at a train station in US' Brooklyn on Tuesday, pictures showing people lying on the station and train floor and bleeding have surfaced online. At least 13 persons were injured, including five from gunshots, at the station. The suspect reportedly escaped the spot and was wearing a construction vest and a gas mask.

253.title: US cannot confirm use of chemical weapons in Ukraine: Official
253.article_body: After Ukraine claimed it is investigating unverified information that Russia may have used chemical weapons in Mariupol, a US defence official said that America cannot confirm the use of chemical agents in the city at this time. The US had no information to support the movement of chemical agents by Russia in or near Ukraine, the official added.

254.title: Awestruck: Axar recalls his and Bumrah's reaction on joining MI in IPL 2013
254.article_body: Recalling his and Jasprit Bumrah's reaction after joining MI in IPL 2013, Axar Patel, who currently represents DC, said both of them were awestruck after seeing Sachin Tendulkar, Rohit Sharma and other players in MI. He added that they were left wondering on what should they do as all "big stars" they used to see on television were present there.

255.title: Electoral bond one of the biggest scams in Indian democracy: Gehlot
255.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday described electoral bond scheme as "one of the biggest scams in Indian democracy", adding that it swings election process in favour of ruling party at Centre. Gehlot alleged that BJP puts pressure on industrialists to obtain donations through electoral bonds. "These bonds are becoming a way to use black money in elections," he added.

256.title: Man who threatened to kill Spain PM Sanchez jailed for 7.5 years
256.article_body: Spain's High Court on Tuesday sentenced a 65-year-old man to seven-and-a-half years in prison for threatening to assassinate Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez on a far-right WhatsApp chat in 2018 and possessing illegal guns. Manuel Murillo Sanchez was sentenced to two-and-a-half years for attempted murder and five years for possession of war weapons.

257.title: British MP found guilty of sexually assaulting 15-year-old boy
257.article_body: British MP Imran Ahmad Khan on Monday was found guilty of sexually assaulting a 15-year-old boy after trying to force him to drink alcohol at a house in 2008. Khan, 48, had denied the allegation. Khan has since been suspended by Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Conservative Party while waiting for the outcome of the trial.

258.title: One producer told me I don't have looks to be an actor: Vivek Oberoi
258.article_body: Vivek Oberoi, who completed 20 years in Bollywood on Tuesday, recalled his early acting days and revealed that a producer once told him that he doesn't have the looks to be an actor. "I was really hurt," Vivek added. The actor further said, "I wanted a job on my own merit rather than my last name...and struggled for 18-29 months."

259.title: All options on the table: UK warns if Russia uses chemical weapons
259.article_body: British Armed Forces Minister James Heappey on Tuesday warned "all possible options are on the table" on how the West would respond if Russia used chemical weapons in Ukraine. "These are appalling weapons to think about using," he said. Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said the UK "will hold Putin and his regime to account" if chemical weapons are used.

260.title: Politician indicted on charge of insulting Thai King Maha Vajiralongkorn
260.article_body: Thai politician Thanathorn Juangroongruangkit was indicted on Monday on charges of insulting King Maha Vajiralongkorn and violating a cyber law. Juangroongruangkit, who now faces up to 20 years in prison, had criticised government last year for awarding contract of COVID-19 vaccines to a company owned by the King. He was granted release on bail of 90,000 baht (over ₹2 lakh).

261.title: Formation of Supertech's Committee of Creditors stayed till April 19
261.article_body: National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has stayed the formation of the Committee of Creditors in the Supertech insolvency case till April 19 as the real estate developer sought time to negotiate with banks. NCLAT has taken into consideration the concerns of all stakeholders, including homebuyers, said Ram Kishor Arora, the petitioner and director of the suspended board of Supertech.

262.title: I’ve got a car that is capable of winning: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc
262.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc said he has "a car that is capable of winning" following his victory at the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. "I know that it's in the car and I just have to do the job, so the mindset is a little bit different this year," Leclerc said. The 24-year-old currently leads the Driver Standings with 71 points.

263.title: Head of Russian artillery intelligence killed in Ukraine: Reports
263.article_body: The head of Russia's artillery intelligence has reportedly been killed in Ukraine. Lieutenant Colonel Vyacheslav Savinov, 40, reportedly died last month in a fierce battle. Savinov was the deputy chief of staff of the Russian Missile Troops and Artillery. He is the 32nd Russian lieutenant colonel or colonel to be killed. Seven Russian generals have also reportedly been killed.

264.title: Currently focussed on IPL, hopeful to play for India one day: PBKS' Vaibhav
264.article_body: PBKS pacer Vaibhav Arora said he's currently focussed on playing in IPL, adding he wants to work on his form and give best results. "Haven't thought a lot about my future plans but if I continue with my good performance then one day hopefully I'll play for India," he added. Vaibhav has taken two wickets from two matches so far.

265.title: I'm not a man for predictions: Karthik on RCB's chances of winning IPL 2022
265.article_body: On being asked about his views on RCB's chances of winning IPL 2022, RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik replied, "(Laughs) I'm not a man for predictions. But I must say the mood in the camp is good." He added, "We are (heading) in a good direction." RCB are currently third in standings, having won three from four matches.

266.title: Poland takes over Russian compound in Warsaw to give to Ukrainians
266.article_body: A fenced compound in Poland's Warsaw, which was "unlawfully occupied" by Russians, will be made available for Ukrainian refugees, Mayor Rafal Trzaskowski said on Monday. The compound, which consists of several empty buildings, was built in a land-swap agreement between Soviet Union and Poland in 1970s and was considered disputed. Trzaskowski, however, added that the compound has been recovered.

267.title: People of Punjab will soon get good news: CM Bhagwant Mann
267.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said his government will soon give "good news" to the people of the state, indicating that it could announce 300 units of free electricity to households. The Opposition criticised AAP earlier today and alleged that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was trying to control the Punjab government through remote control.

268.title: CSK record highest total of IPL 2022, break DC's record
268.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) put up a total of 216/4 against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) on Tuesday to record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far. The previous highest total in IPL 2022 was 215/5, which was recorded by Delhi Capitals (DC) against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). Shivam Dube top-scored for CSK with 95*(46), while Robin Uthappa scored 88(50).

269.title: 403 bodies found in Ukraine's Bucha after Russian retreat: Mayor
269.article_body: The Mayor of Bucha in Ukraine, Anatoliy Fedoruk, on Tuesday said that 403 bodies of people have been found in the town so far, following a retreat by Russian forces last month. Ukraine has accused Russian forces of killing civilians during their occupation of Bucha. Fedoruk claimed that it was too early for residents to return to the town.

270.title: I was taken to a nude couple after being intoxicated: Woman on sex racket in Delhi spa
270.article_body: A 27-year-old woman was rescued by Delhi Commission for Women and Delhi Police from a sex racket allegedly being operated inside a spa centre in Azadpur, Delhi. "She informed...she was given...intoxicant after which she started losing her senses...She was taken inside a room where there was a nude couple," a notice said. She alleged someone tried to rape her.

271.title: Gangrape survivor in PoK seeks PM Modi's help, says, 'allow us to come to India'
271.article_body: A gangrape survivor in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir has sought PM Narendra Modi's help in a video message that is being circulated online. Stating that she has been fighting for justice for past seven years, the woman said, "Allow us to come to India...The local police and a senior politician, Choudhary Tariq Farooq, will anytime kill me and my children."

272.title: Video of Brooklyn mass shooting surfaces, smoke seen inside train
272.article_body: A video from the site of the mass shooting in New York's Brooklyn has shown smoke pouring out of a train and commuters running away from it. At least 13 people were injured, including five from being shot at, at a Brooklyn subway station on Tuesday. Reports had suggested a possible explosion had occurred at the site of the attack.

273.title: Robin Uthappa records most sixes in an innings in IPL 2022
273.article_body: CSK opener Robin Uthappa on Tuesday recorded the most sixes in an innings in IPL 2022 so far. The 36-year-old slammed nine sixes against RCB, overtaking KKR all-rounder Andre Russell, who had slammed eight sixes against PBKS on April 1. Uthappa scored 88 runs off 50 deliveries, his highest-ever score in IPL.

274.title: Ropeway was shaking, passengers screamed: Tribals on J'khand cable car accident
274.article_body: Some tribals who rescued eight tourists from two cable cars after a ropeway accident in Jharkhand's Deoghar district shared what they saw at the time of the incident. A local said he heard a loud thud and the ropeway was shaking violently and the passengers were screaming. "I found panic-stricken people, including two girls, screaming inside the trolleys," he added.

275.title: If oil prices remain above $110 a barrel, burden will have to be shared: CEA
275.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor Dr V Anantha Nageswaran said if global crude oil prices remain above $110 per barrel for more than a quarter, then the burden will have to be shared by the government, oil marketing companies and consumers. He told CNBC-TV18, "The burden needs to be shared because this is a global supply shock...It hasn't been engineered by anyone."

276.title: Man held with 1.3 kg charas worth lakhs of rupees in J&K's Poonch
276.article_body: An alleged drug peddler was arrested in the Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir, police said on Tuesday. About 1.3 kilograms of charas, which is estimated to be worth lakhs of rupees, was also recovered from his possession. According to the police, he was intercepted on Monday after a police party found him moving suspiciously during patrolling.

277.title: Elephant kills Colombian researcher in Ugandan national park
277.article_body: A Colombian researcher, Sebastian Ramirez Amaya, was trampled to death by an elephant on Sunday in Uganda's Kibale National Park, according to Ugandan authorities. Amaya was researching a doctorate on the social lives of male and female chimpanzees. Notably, Amaya's death comes three months after a Saudi tourist was killed by an elephant in another national park in the country.

278.title: FIFA launch new digital streaming service, to include live games
278.article_body: FIFA has launched a new digital streaming service called FIFA+ which will include free live games and "Netflix style" documentaries. "This project represents a cultural shift in the way different types of football fans want to connect with and explore the global game," FIFA President Gianni Infantino said. The new platform will be funded by advertisers.

279.title: Peace talks with Ukraine are at a dead end: Russian President Putin
279.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday said that peace talks with Ukraine are "at a dead end". This is the first time Putin addressed the war in public since Russian forces retreated from northern Ukraine after they were halted at the gates of Kyiv. Putin promised that Russia would achieve all of its "noble" aims in Ukraine.

280.title: You have to quickly move on: Bumrah to Sams after his 35-run over vs KKR
280.article_body: MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah said teammate Daniel Sams is an experienced cricketer and understands that he needs to "quickly" move on from the match against KKR as he conceded 35 runs in one over. He added that in T20 cricket anybody can get hit but it's important that one shouldn't carry the baggage going further because there are back-to-back matches.

281.title: Goa CM allots portfolios to 3 new ministers, Dhavalikar gets Power dept
281.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant allotted portfolios to newly-inducted ministers Ramkrishna alias Sudin Dhavalikar, Nilkanth Halarnkar and Subhash Phal Dessai on Tuesday. Dhavalikar has been given the Power, New and Renewable Energy and Housing portfolios, while Halarnkar will handle Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Factories departments. Dessai has been given Social Welfare and two other departments.

282.title: UEFA orders Atletico Madrid to partially close stadium for Man City game
282.article_body: UEFA has ordered Atletico Madrid to partially close their stadium for their Champions League second-leg quarter-final match against Manchester City after being punished for the behaviour of their fans during the first-leg in Manchester. Two charges for discriminatory behaviour and throwing objects was initiated on Friday. Manchester City won the first-leg clash 1-0.

283.title: US retail inflation rose 8.5% in FY22, highest since 1981
283.article_body: Retail inflation in the US rose 8.5% in FY22, its highest level since 1981, and rose 1.2% in March 2022, the highest since 2005. Increase in prices of gasoline, food and housing contributed the most to rise in retail inflation in March. While gasoline prices rose 48% in FY22, food and housing inflation rose 8.8% and 5% respectively.

284.title: Baap, baap hota hai: Abhishek to fan who said he is now more famous than Big B
284.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan has reacted to a fan's tweet who praised the actor's work in 'Dasvi'. The Twitter user had written, "After this movie, looking at Amitabh Bachchan people will say, 'See that man, he is Abhishek's father'."  Replying to this, Abhishek wrote, "Thank you for the compliment but...Never! Baap, baap hota hai (father is after all a father)."

285.title: It’s going to be a big task: Red Bull's Verstappen on F1 title defence
285.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen said it will be a big task to defend his title this season. Red Bull's Verstappen suffered a second retirement in three races at the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. "We are already miles behind so I don't even want to think about the championship fight at the moment," the 24-year-old said.

286.title: Had fear of getting pregnant: Amrita on getting anxiety attack while conceiving
286.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao has revealed that she had a fear of getting pregnant. "Women around me used to tell me that the whole process is natural and all," she stated. "But a baby is developing in your body and thinking about this caused me discomfort," she added. Amrita further said that she got an anxiety attack while trying to conceive.

287.title: Mumbai court grants bail to 3 accused in 'Bulli Bai' app case
287.article_body: A court in Mumbai on Tuesday granted bail to three students arrested in the 'Bulli Bai' app case. Magistrate KC Rajput of Bandra court granted bail to Vishal Kumar Jha, Shweta Singh and Mayank Agarwal. Previously, both the Magistrate and sessions court had denied them bail, but the three filed their pleas again after the police submitted a charge sheet.

288.title: Things will get better for CSK if Dhoni is back as captain: RP Singh
288.article_body: Ex-India cricketer RP Singh has said if MS Dhoni is re-appointed as CSK captain then things will get better for the defending champions as they've lost four consecutive matches in ongoing IPL. "There are problems in both batting and bowling. It doesn't happen often that CSK changes its playing XI after just two-three games and changes batting order," he added.

289.title: Prez Biden briefed on New York City subway shooting: White House
289.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Tuesday said that US President Joe Biden has been briefed on the latest developments regarding New York City subway shooting. White House senior staff are in touch with Mayor Eric Adams and Police Commissioner Keechant Sewell to offer any assistance as needed, she added. At least 13 people were injured in the shooting.

290.title: Russia's economy set for biggest contraction since 1994: Report
290.article_body: Russia's economy is on track to contract by over 10% in 2022, said Alexei Kudrin, who served as Russia's Finance Minister from 2000 to 2011. A contraction of 10% would be the biggest decline in GDP since 1994, according to World Bank and IMF data, Reuters reported. World Bank this month forecast Russian GDP output would fall 11.2% this year.

291.title: Punjab govt directs pvt schools to list shops selling books, uniforms
291.article_body: Under the direction of Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, the state education department has ordered the private schools of the state to share the list of books and uniform shops with the District Education Officers (DEOs). According to an official release, the schools have also been ordered not to force the parents to buy books and uniforms from any specific shop.

292.title: 4 win bronze in India's best performance at European Girls' Mathematical Olympiad
292.article_body: All four contestants who represented India at the 11th European Girls' Mathematical Olympiad held in Hungary during April 6-12 have won bronze medals. Pune's Ananya Rajas Ranade, Delhi's Anushka Aggarwal and Gunjan Aggarwal, and Nashik's Sanika Borade won the medals. It marks India's best performance to date and the first time India has come in the top 20 countries.

293.title: Punjab, other states go to Delhi to understand CM's governance: AAP
293.article_body: Hours after the Opposition alleged that the Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was ruling Punjab through a "remote control", AAP leaders said that Punjab, other states go to Delhi to understand Kejriwal's model of governance. "Arvind Kejriwal is our party's national convenor. We take his guidance so there is nothing wrong with that," the party leaders were quoted as saying.

294.title: Rise above caste & religion: Vice President Naidu tells students
294.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Tuesday advised the youth to rise above "narrow considerations such as caste, religion and region". Naidu, who made these remarks at an interaction with some Telugu students from Delhi University, added that one cannot be a leader if they're not tolerant. He also reiterated the importance of protecting and promoting one's mother tongue.

295.title: I've got an idea for something, I'm hopefully going to direct: Daniel
295.article_body: Daniel Radcliffe said he'll "hopefully" be making a directorial debut in a "couple of years". "I've got an idea for something that I've written," he stated. "It'll be in a couple of years' time, because the next 18 months...are pretty much accounted for already," he further said. Daniel added he would just direct the project and not star in it.

296.title: We are in transition phase: Bumrah after MI's 4 losses in 4 games
296.article_body: Following MI's four losses in four matches in IPL 2022, MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah said his side is going through a transition phase as they've got some new players in the mega auction. "We've got some old core group, some of them, as well, but a lot of new guys who are understanding the team...franchise...how the scenarios work," he stated.

297.title: I'm not at fault: K'taka Minister as contractor blames him in suicide note
297.article_body: Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa has claimed that he wasn't responsible for the suicide of contractor Santosh Patil who has blamed him for his death in a note. "We have to wait for the verdict...in the case I had filed against Patil. I make it very clear that I'm not at fault anywhere," Eshwarappa said. Patil had accused him of corruption.

298.title: Mastercard files 15 metaverse, NFT related trademark applications
298.article_body: Mastercard has filed 15 metaverse and NFT-related trademark applications with the US Patent and Trademark Office. The applications include trademarks for virtual cards and payments in the metaverse and an application to create an NFT marketplace. "We are continually looking for opportunities to deliver new and unique experiences to our customers and cardholders," a Mastercard spokesperson said.

299.title: Contractors can't work if harassed: Kharge on K'taka contractor's death
299.article_body: Congress’ Mallikarjun Kharge said on Tuesday that Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai should take action on the suicide of contractor Santosh Patil. "Contractors...take loans to complete their work, if ministers keep harassing them, they will not be able to work," Kharge added. Patil, who had accused Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa of corruption, died by suicide at a lodge in Udupi.

300.title: ED summons ex-Xiaomi India MD in foreign funding probe: Report
300.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned ex-Xiaomi India MD MK Jain to probe if the firm's business practices complied with Indian foreign exchange laws, Reuters reported citing sources. A Xiaomi spokesperson said the firm was "fully compliant with all the regulations". ED is looking into existing business structures between Xiaomi India, its contract manufacturers and its parent entity in China.

301.title: UP rape convict who jumped parole held after 33 years from Delhi
301.article_body: A rape convict from Uttar Pradesh's Hathras district who had jumped parole has been arrested after 33 years from Delhi's Sant Nagar. The convict, 56-year-old Raghunandan Singh, was living under a fake identity with his wife and worked at a garment retail outlet. Hathras Superintendent of Police Vineet Jaiswal said he had announced a reward of ₹25,000 on Singh's arrest.

302.title: Australian Minister flies to Solomon Islands for talks on China pact
302.article_body: Australia's Minister for the Pacific, Zed Seselja, will arrive in Solomon Islands on Tuesday to discuss a proposed security pact between the Pacific island nation and China. A draft version of the pact was leaked last month. Australia and the US have reacted with concern to the agreement that would allow China to deploy its military in the region.

303.title: No active explosive devices at Brooklyn train station: Police on mass shooting
303.article_body: After at least 13 people were reportedly injured in a mass shooting at a train station in New York's Brooklyn, the city's police department NYPD said there were currently no active explosive devices at the scene. This came after reports said unexploded devices were also found at the site of the attack. "Please stay clear of the area," said NYPD.

304.title: BJP's rigging crossed limits in UP Legislative Council polls: Yadav
304.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said that BJP's rigging crossed all limits in Uttar Pradesh Legislative Council polls. "The BJP has no faith in the Constitution, democracy and the process of fair elections. It is trying to weaken constitutional institutions in order to remain in power by means of money and deceit," Yadav said.

305.title: Absolute treat: Finch picks Kohli, Babar as batters with best cover drive
305.article_body: During a Q&A session on KKR's Twitter handle, a fan asked Aaron Finch who he thinks plays the best cover drive. The Australia white-ball skipper replied, "Virat Kohli and Babar Azam- it's an absolute treat watching the two of these guys play that shot." Finch has joined the KKR camp in the ongoing IPL 2022 after completing international duties.

306.title: Heavy rainfall likely in Kerala, Tamil Nadu for next 2 days: IMD
306.article_body: The India Meteorological Department on Tuesday predicted that thunderstorms and heavy rainfall are likely to occur in Kerala and Tamil Nadu for the next two days. Taking to Twitter, the weather department said that fishermen are advised not to venture into rough seas. The IMD has also predicted some respite from the ongoing heatwave conditions over northwest India from Tuesday.

307.title: 'Doctor Strange 2' has got a darker tone to it: Benedict Cumberbatch
307.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch, speaking about 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', has said, "It's got a sort of darker tone to it...with Sam Raimi at the helm, you know he's a master of that." Benedict further said, "It's pretty unfathomably exciting where we're going in this film. It's the most fantastic new phase of Marvel."

308.title: Pregnant Rihanna poses on the cover of Vogue
308.article_body: Singer Rihanna, who is pregnant, posed for the cover of Vogue US' May edition. "Our lil fashion killa on da cover of VOGUE!!" she wrote while sharing the cover on Instagram. Rihanna, who shared the news of her pregnancy earlier this year, is expecting her first child with boyfriend A$AP Rocky.

309.title: FIR against Congress' Digvijay Singh over post on Khargone violence
309.article_body: An FIR has been registered against senior Congress leader Digvijay Singh over a tweet on the Khargone violence that broke out during a Ram Navami procession. Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticised Singh and termed his tweet a conspiracy to spread religious frenzy in the state. MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra had warned Singh of a legal action.

310.title: Russian soldiers kept Ukrainian women in basement for 25 days; 9 now said to be pregnant
310.article_body: Ukraine's official ombudsman for human rights, Lyudmyla Denisova, has said that Russian soldiers had kept a group of Ukrainian women and girls in a basement of a house for 25 days. Nine of them are now pregnant, she stated. Denisova claimed that Russian soldiers used sexual violence as a weapon of war against Ukrainian women.

311.title: I didn't abuse my paid leave, returned to work 2 days after father's death: Nooyi
311.article_body: PepsiCo's former CEO Indra Nooyi recently spoke about how she "didn't abuse" the six months of paid leave in her early career. "After my father was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer, BCG offered me six months of paid leave for his care," she said. "At the end of...three months...he died...and in three months, two days...I was back at work," she added.

312.title: Rehab is rocking: Federer shares pics training in the gym
312.article_body: Providing an update on his knee injury rehabilitation, 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer took to Instagram to post pictures of him training in the gym. "Rehab is rockinggggggg," he captioned the post. Federer hasn't played since Wimbledon 2021. The 40-year-old underwent a third right knee surgery in August last year. He's currently ranked 43rd in the world.

313.title: 20 dead after overnight rainfall in South African province
313.article_body: At least 20 people have died in South Africa's coastal province of KwaZulu-Natal due to floods triggered by overnight rainfall, officials said. Disaster management teams have been evacuating locals from mudslide and flood-prone areas, province's emergency spokesperson Robert Mckenzie said. Mckenzie further advised local residents to remain indoors amid reports of collapsed infrastructure.

314.title: Mass shooting & possible explosion in NYC subway station, many injured: Reports
314.article_body: Multiple people have been injured in a mass shooting and a possible explosion at a train station in New York's Brooklyn, reports said on Tuesday. Explosive devices have also reportedly been found at the site of the attack which occurred during the morning rush hour. Pictures shared online showed commuters at the scene with blood on their clothes.

315.title: SRK gave me a piece of advice before I became an actor: Abhishek
315.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan said Shah Rukh Khan gave him advice when he was set to become an actor. "SRK said there are two kinds of actors. Both run...there's one who runs because...mad dog is chasing him...other runs because he loves running," Abhishek said. He added, "SRK told...always be...second one. Do it because you love it...not because you're compelled by anything."

316.title: Trying to save culprits: WB Cong chief on CM's 'love affair' remark
316.article_body: Responding to West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's 'love affair' remark on the Nadia rape case, the state's Congress chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that she was trying to "save the culprits". "Despite being a woman, CM is giving statements that there was a love affair and other things. She is saying all this to divert public attention," he added.

317.title: Imran Khan calls for 'immediate' polls after being removed as Pak PM
317.article_body: Pakistan's ex-PM Imran Khan has called for "immediate" federal elections in the country after he was removed from office by the Opposition. "Let the people decide, through fair & free elections, whom they want as their prime minister," he tweeted. Khan said that he will hold a rally in Peshawar on Wednesday after "being removed through a foreign-instigated regime change".

318.title: Domestic patent filings surpass int'l filings in India for 1st time in 11 years
318.article_body: The number of domestic patent filing surpassed the number of international patent filing at Indian patent office for the first time in 11 years. Out of 19,796 patent applications filed during January-March 2022 quarter, 10,706 were filed by Indian applicants, the government said. Further, the number of patents filed in India increased 50% in seven years to 66,440 in 2021-22.

319.title: UK PM Boris Johnson, Finance Minister Rishi Sunak to be fined over lockdown parties
319.article_body: British PM Boris Johnson and Finance Minister Rishi Sunak are to receive fines for breaching strict coronavirus lockdown rules, a government statement said on Tuesday. Police have been investigating 12 gatherings at Downing Street and the Cabinet Office after an internal inquiry found Johnson's staff had enjoyed alcohol-fuelled parties. The PM had attended a few of the events himself.

320.title: Was the last thing I was planning on: Kim Kardashian on dating Pete
320.article_body: Television personality Kim Kardashian has said that dating Pete Davidson was the last thing she was planning on. "Sometimes things happen when you just least expect it," she stated. "It just makes it that much sweeter and so much more fun," Kim added. Kim had filed for divorce from rapper Kanye West in February 2021.

321.title: No question of resigning: KS Eshwarappa after contractor's death
321.article_body: Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa on Tuesday said that he won't be resigning after contractor Santhosh K Patil, in his suicide note, claimed that the minister was solely responsible for his death. "I had lodged a defamation case against the person who accused me of (corruption). He should've fought it in the court, I'm nowhere related to his suicide," Eshwarappa said.

322.title: RCB to bowl first as winless CSK lose toss for the 4th time, playing XIs announced
322.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK. CSK, who lost their first four IPL 2022 matches, lost the toss for the fourth time. RCB have made two changes to their playing XI, with Suyash Prabhudessai and Josh Hazlewood replacing Harshal Patel and David Willey, respectively. CSK are fielding an unchanged side.

323.title: Growing Muslim population isn't threat but radical thinking: Giriraj
323.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh has said that the "increasing population of Muslims isn't a threat, but radical thinking is a threat to India". He added the repeated incidents of stone-pelting on Ram Navami or any procession aren't a "coincidence, but an experiment". His remarks came amid communal violence incidents that broke out in India's several parts during Ram Navami processions.

324.title: Sidhu Moose Wala releases song on his Punjab poll defeat; AAP criticises him
324.article_body: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moose Wala has released a song titled 'Scapegoat', which is based on his defeat as Congress candidate in the recent state Assembly elections. AAP leader Malwinder Singh Kang accused Moose Wala of referring to people of Punjab as 'gaddar' (traitors) in his song. "Punjabis are neither traitors nor hypocrites," AAP MLA Jeevan Jyot Kaur tweeted.

325.title: Have learned lot from Dhoni, he's fantastic captain: RCB skipper Du Plessis
325.article_body: Ahead of RCB-CSK in IPL 2022, RCB captain Faf du Plessis said his ex-team CSK has a special place in his heart. "I'm extremely grateful for Chennai and being around them for more than 10 years...I've learned a lot from MS Dhoni, he's a fantastic captain as well," he added. "It would be...great to play against Chennai," he further said.

326.title: Raj govt sanctions water train for Pali, will cost ₹15 lakh/day
326.article_body: Rajasthan government has sanctioned a water train to supply drinking water to the parched city of Pali from April 15. The water train will reportedly cost ₹15 lakh/day. Apart from this, the government is also supplying water to 208 towns, out of which 18 are getting water once every 96 hours and 15 are getting water once every 72 hours.

327.title: Ram didn't walk away with all the accolades for 'RRR': Rajamouli
327.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli has reacted to the claims that Ram Charan was given more screen time than Jr NTR in 'RRR'. "That wasn't the right way of putting it, that Ram walked away with all the accolades," Rajamouli stated. He added, "If you look...from a certain perspective, it might seem like one actor has been given more screen space."

328.title: Blind US man drives car at 339kmh to break Guinness Record on accident's 10th anniversary
328.article_body: US race car driver Dan Parker, who was blinded in an accident, drove a customised car at a speed of 339.64 kmh to achieve the Guinness World Records title for "Fastest Speed for a Car Driven Blindfolded" on March 31. Parker achieved the feat by breaking the previous record of 322.68 kmh on the 10th anniversary of his accident.

329.title: He said 'Take your clothes off or I'll shoot': Ukrainian woman raped by Russian soldier
329.article_body: A 50-year-old Ukrainian woman was at home when a soldier barged in and dragged her to a house nearby, she said. "He was ordering me 'Take your clothes off or I'll shoot you'. While he was raping me, four more soldiers entered...They took him away," she stated. She further said her husband was shot and he died two days later.

330.title: Saudi govt-owned channel mocks US President & VP Harris in comedy sketch
330.article_body: A major Saudi government-owned broadcaster has aired a sketch mocking US President Joe Biden and Vice-President Kamala Harris. The sketch aired on MBC's show 'Studio 22', showed Biden's character as sleepy and forgetful, even as the actor portraying Harris stopped him from wandering off. The actor playing Biden is also heard calling Harris his "first lady".

331.title: Did others go there to drink lassi: Harbhajan on Dhoni getting credit for World Cup win
331.article_body: Talking about cricket being a team game, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said that when India won the 2011 World Cup, headlines said, "MS Dhoni won India the World Cup." Harbhajan stated, "Did others go there to drink lassi? What did Gautam Gambhir do, what did others do?" He added that a team progresses only when multiple players contribute.

332.title: Husband-wife's OfBusiness seeks $2 bn in India's biggest tech IPO since Paytm
332.article_body: Husband-wife Asish Mohapatra and Ruchi Kalra's unicorn startup OfBusiness, a supplier of raw materials to small businesses, is in discussions with banks about raising $2 billion in an IPO, Bloomberg reported. At $2 billion, Gurugram-headquartered OfBusiness' IPO could be India's largest tech IPO after Paytm's. While Asish is the CEO of OfBusiness, Kalra has her own unicorn startup Oxyzo.

333.title: Thinking about Kohli's gesture after my 1st IPL ton still gives me goosebumps: Padikkal
333.article_body: RR batter Devdutt Padikkal said thinking about Virat Kohli's gesture after his first IPL hundred still gives him goosebumps. Padikkal, who represented RCB in IPL 2020 and 2021, revealed after he scored the hundred against RR in 2021, the then RCB captain asked the cameraman to focus on Padikkal instead of him as Padikkal was the "main man" that day.

334.title: PM to receive 1st award named in memory of Lata Mangeshkar on Apr 24
334.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will receive first Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award for selfless service to nation on April 24. The award has been instituted in memory of veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar, who died at the age of 92 in February. "This award will be given every year to only one individual who has made path-breaking...contributions to our nation," a statement said.

335.title: Hospitals face shortage of medicines, cancel surgeries in Sri Lanka
335.article_body: Hospitals in Sri Lanka are facing a shortage of medicines amid a severe economic crisis in the country. This has led to some surgeries being cancelled, according to Reuters. Out of 1,325 drugs that the government provides to state-run hospitals, three life-saving medicines have completely run out and another 140 essential ones are in short supply, an official said.

336.title: J'khand HC takes suo motu cognisance of cable-car mishap, orders probe
336.article_body: Jharkhand High Court has taken suo motu cognisance of the cable car collision incident in Deoghar and ordered an inquiry into the matter. It'll hear the matter on April 26 and the state has to file a detailed inquiry report through an affidavit. Notably, three persons died in the incident and others were rescued as the rescue operation ended today.

337.title: Mann is a rubber stamp, Kejriwal has taken over Punjab: Amarinder Singh
337.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Tuesday called current Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann a "rubber stamp" and alleged that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has taken over Punjab. His remark came following Kejriwal's meeting with the officials of the Punjab State Power Corporation Limited (PSPCL) in the absence of CM Bhagwant Mann.

338.title: UP tea stall owners rename shop as 'Bulldozer Baba' as tribute to CM
338.article_body: The owners of a tea stall in UP's Varanasi have renamed their shop as 'Bulldozer Baba Tea Stall' as a "mark of respect" to CM Yogi Adityanath. "Our tea is as 'kadak' as the bulldozer," owner Ram Surat said. The moniker has come to be associated with CM Yogi following his use of bulldozers to crackdown on properties of criminals.

339.title: 1st made-in-India Dornier 228 plane takes off for maiden commercial flight
339.article_body: The first-ever made-in-India civil Dornier 228 aircraft with 17 seats took off on Tuesday for its first commercial flight from Dibrugarh (Assam) to Pasighat (Arunachal Pradesh). The flight is operated by Alliance Air, making it India's first commercial airline to fly India-made aircraft for civil operations. Union Ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia and Kiren Rijiju were onboard the flight.

340.title: Ravindra Jadeja's bat has been absolutely silent in IPL 2022: Aakash
340.article_body: Discussing Ravindra Jadeja's form in IPL 2022, ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra said the CSK captain's bat has been "absolutely silent". He added, "If he doesn't score runs, the team will not go a long way. With the ball, Jaddu (Jadeja) has done well against Glenn Maxwell." Jadeja has scored 26*, 17, 0, 23 in the tournament so far.

341.title: TMC's Supriyo alleges electoral malpractice by BJP in WB bypolls
341.article_body: Accusing the BJP of engaging in electoral malpractices, TMC's Ballygunge Assembly by-poll candidate, Babul Supriyo, on Tuesday claimed that "BJP candidate Keya Ghosh entered a couple of booths last night". He added, "TMC has lodged an official complaint with the Election Commission. We got a reaction from them." He also claimed that EVMs weren't working properly in over 20 places.

342.title: Will create 1.3 million jobs in 5 yrs: Australian PM ahead of polls
342.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison has pledged to create 1.3 million new jobs over five years in his latest poll pitch, ahead of country's federal elections in May. "Boosting job creation to...levels we saw...before...pandemic is key to our plan for...stronger economy," he said. Morrison added that his government has reduced Australia's unemployment rate despite global recession and other challenges.

343.title: 60 kg lemons, 40 kg onions stolen from UP warehouse amid price rise
343.article_body: Around 60 kg of lemons along with 40 kg of onions and 38 kg of garlic were stolen from a warehouse in UP's Shahjahanpur. The trader told police he found the godown's lock broken with vegetables lying scattered on road in the morning on Monday. Police believe the rising prices of lemons could be a possible reason for the theft.

344.title: Retail inflation rises to 17-month-high of 6.95% in March 2022
344.article_body: India's retail inflation jumped to a 17-month high of 6.95% in March 2022 due to higher food and oil prices, data released by the government on Tuesday showed. This is the third consecutive month in which retail inflation has breached the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) upper margin of 6%. The country's retail inflation stood at 6.01% for February 2022.

345.title: Father said 'Now nothing can be changed' Axar on 'Akshar' becoming 'Axar' on documents
345.article_body: Talking about his name becoming 'Axar' from 'Akshar' after his school principal mistakenly wrote 'Axar' in his relieving certificate, the Delhi Capitals all-rounder said, "NCA asked me about my name being 'Axar' on passport...after which I called my father." "My father said, 'Now....nothing can be changed'," he added. "Everything was going well...so I thought let's not change 'Axar'," he stated.

346.title: New Pak PM reduces weekly offs, changes office timing from 10 am to 8 am on 1st day
346.article_body: Pakistan's new PM Shehbaz Sharif, on the first day in office, reduced two weekly offs to one in government offices and changed their timings to 8 am instead of 10 am. He announced that only Sunday will be the weekly off day. "We have come to serve the masses and no moment will be wasted," he said.

347.title: Record for highest price rise in India goes to Cong: K'taka CM
347.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the credit and record for highest price rise in India go to Congress. "Congress has no moral right to protest against price rise," Bommai added. "The rising prices have made life difficult for the common man," Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar had said earlier.

348.title: Bringing deprived classes to mainstream is BJP's objective: K'taka CM
348.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Monday evening said that BJP's objective is to bring the deprived and voiceless classes to the mainstream. "Over the years, many programmes have been drawn to bring equality in India, but have not been implemented effectively. Our government has formulated action plans to deliver our promises," he further said.

349.title: B'luru Police conduct drive against unauthorised number plates
