349.article_body: The Bengaluru City Police on Tuesday carried out a special drive against unauthorised vehicle number plates, police informed on Twitter. During the drive, the police issued fines against people over the same and removed the unauthorised number plates from their vehicles, according to the information shared on Twitter. Police have shared pictures of the drive on their official Twitter handle.

350.title: Can you help me understand numbers better?: Ashneer on BharatPe's 'best month'
350.article_body: Ashneer Grover responded after BharatPe's CPO Ankur Jain said "March 2022 was the best month" in BharatPe's journey. "The last few months...were tumultuous. However, everyone...rallied around and executed brilliantly," Jain said. Sharing a report on BharatPe's performance under him, Ashneer replied, "Sir, numbers are much better expressed quantitatively. Could you help me understand them better?"

351.title: Jailed Egyptian pro-democracy activist receives UK citizenship
351.article_body: Jailed activist Alaa Abdel-Fattah, who gained prominence during Egypt's 2011 uprising, has received British citizenship, his family confirmed on Monday. Fattah, who was arrested in 2019, is currently serving a five-year prison term after being charged with spreading fake news. Fattah's family said in a statement that he has been kept in a jail cell that receives no sunlight.

352.title: Childhood pic of Aishwarya surfaces online, fans draw resemblance to Aaradhya
352.article_body: A childhood picture of actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan from an old ad has surfaced online. Several Instagram users drew a resemblance to her daughter Aaradhya Bachchan after an Instagram account posted Aishwarya's photograph from the ad. "Wow, Aaradhya looks just like Aishwarya," a user commented on the post. "Aaradhya resembles her mother," another user reacted.

353.title: Man robbed of ₹8 lakh by 4 people in Noida's Sector 88
353.article_body: Over ₹8 lakh were stolen from a man by four unidentified assailants at a vegetable market in Noida Sector 88, an official said on Tuesday. The complainant works for a businessman who supplies vegetables to vendors in the market and he would collect money from vendors on his boss' behalf. The police have formed four teams to nab the assailants.

354.title: Country setting new benchmarks in field of health: PM Modi
354.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday hailed people's resolve in the fight against COVID-19 and said that India is setting new benchmarks in the field of health. "Whether it is the world's largest free vaccination campaign with indigenous vaccines or the development of medical infrastructure, the country is setting new benchmarks in the field of health," he said.

355.title: PML(N) leaders say Nawaz Sharif not returning to Pak soon: Report
355.article_body: Senior PML(N) leaders have ruled out possibility of Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif's brother and ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's immediate return to country, Dawn reported. "Sharif family thinks...[Nawaz's] early return will establish...Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf's propaganda that he doesn't have serious health issues," a party leader said. Nawaz Sharif has been residing in London since 2019 for medical treatment.

356.title: Hyd Police's discount offer on pending traffic challans to end on Friday
356.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday informed the time for clearing pending traffic challans on a discount offer will end on April 15 (Friday). Requesting the public to utilise the opportunity, police said the offer will not be extended. Under the scheme, two-wheelers are given a 75% discount on pending challans, whereas a 50% discount is being given to car owners.

357.title: Oil breaches $100 mark again as China eases COVID-19 curbs
357.article_body: Oil price breached the $100 mark again on Tuesday after relaxation of COVID-19 curbs in Shanghai eased concerns about Chinese demand. Brent crude rose by $3.26 to $101.74/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) rose $3.01 to $97.3/barrel. Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries' warning that it would be impossible to replace potential supply losses from Russia also affected prices.

358.title: Bomb hurled near Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's 'Jansabha' site in Nalanda
358.article_body: A bomb was hurled near Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's 'Jansabha' (public meeting) in Nalanda district on Tuesday. One person has been detained in connection with the incident. This comes days after Kumar was attacked by a man, who is believed to be mentally unstable, during an event at his hometown Bakhtiyarpur in Patna.

359.title: Superb: Shiv Sena MP on Jaishankar's remarks on India's Russian oil imports
359.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi on Tuesday praised Foreign Minister S Jaishankar's remarks in the US on India's oil purchase from Russia. Jaishankar while replying to a question said India's total monthly purchase of oil from Russia is probably less than what Europe does in an afternoon. "Superb from EAM!," Chaturvedi tweeted with clapping emojis.

360.title: Renowned Indian-American surgeon demoted over 'ghost surgeries' in US
360.article_body: Renowned Indian American surgeon Dr Anil Nanda has been removed as the head of the Department of Neurosurgery at Rutgers medical school in US' New Jersey, amid allegations of performing 'ghost surgeries', the university announced. Ghost surgeries refer to surgeons conducting surgeries on another surgeon's patient with mutual agreement but without informing the patient, who is under anaesthesia.

361.title: 70-yr-old newly elected Pak PM married 5 times, currently has 2 wives
361.article_body: The newly-elected 70-year-old Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has married five times and presently has two wives, Nusrat and Tehmina Durani, while he divorced the three others, namely- Alia Hani, Nilofar Khosa and Kulsoom Hai. He has two sons and three daughters from Nusrat and one daughter from Alia. Shehbaz is the younger brother of three-time former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif.

362.title: De Villiers batted that way in his prime: Shastri on Suryakumar's 37-ball 68*
362.article_body: Reacting to MI batter Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 68 off 37 balls against RCB, Ravi Shastri said Suryakumar's gameplay is very unreal, comparing his knock to performances by AB de Villiers in his prime. "Unbelievable. He played a gem," added Shastri. "When you have your team on the mat, to throw a counter-punch like he did, it was amazing," stated Shastri.

363.title: 19,600 Russian soldiers killed, 732 enemy tanks destroyed: Ukraine
363.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Ministry on Tuesday claimed that about 19,600 Russian soldiers have been killed since the Russian invasion began on February 24. The ministry said its military has destroyed 732 Russian tanks and nearly 300 aircraft, including 140 helicopters. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 1,946 armoured personnel carriers, 349 artillery systems and 111 multiple launch rocket systems.

364.title: 35-year-old Kiwi pacer Hamish Bennett retires from all forms of cricket
364.article_body: New Zealand pacer Hamish Bennett (35) announced retirement from all forms of cricket on Tuesday. Bennett said that the ongoing 2021/22 season will be the last of his 17-year-long professional career. "When I started out as a young kid bowling...in Timaru, I never dreamed I would have gone on to enjoy the career that I've had," Bennett said.

365.title: Robbers loot gold, cash from 2 express trains on same night in UP
365.article_body: Armed robbers attacked two express trains and looted gold ornaments, cash, mobile phones and other valuables around Sunday midnight in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad. Seven passengers on the trains, Amritsar Express and Faizabad Express, were injured in the incident. As per a railway official, there is no total estimate of the looted items yet.

366.title: Anupam reveals Sooraj Barjatya worked as clapper boy in his 1984 film Saaransh
366.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a video from the sets of his upcoming film 'Uunchai', which is being directed by Sooraj Barjatya. In the video, Anupam can be seen holding a clapper board and giving a clap during the shoot. "During...'Saaransh', Sooraj was...assistant and...clapper boy...So it was fun to do...same job while he's directing...magnum opus #Uunchai," Anupam wrote.

367.title: Russia will achieve noble aims of Ukraine military campaign: Putin
367.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday said that Moscow's military operation in Ukraine would undoubtedly achieve its "noble" objectives. Putin added that Moscow "did not have a choice" but to launch a military operation to protect itself and save people in the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine, where Russian-backed separatists have been fighting Ukrainian forces since 2014.

368.title: MP govt cannot bulldoze country's law, Constitution: Brinda Karat
368.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Brinda Karat on Tuesday condemned the Madhya Pradesh government saying it cannot bulldoze the 'law and Constitution of the country'. Her comments came after the government demolished houses of those who pelted stones at a Ram Navami procession in Khargone on Sunday. "If the houses are illegal, then serve notice to them," she added.

369.title: Army Chief to visit Bombay Engineer Group and Centre in Pune today
369.article_body: Chief of Army Staff (COAS) General Manoj Mukund Naravane is scheduled to visit the Bombay Engineer Group and Centre in Pune on Tuesday. According to the officials, the army chief will formally induct indigenously developed High Mobility Vehicles (HMVs) and Long Range Observation System into the Indian Army. Notably, the COAS will preside over the induction ceremony as well.

370.title: Iran asks Taliban to ensure safety of its diplomats in Afghanistan
370.article_body: Iran has asked the Taliban to ensure the safety of its diplomats and embassies in Afghanistan. This comes amid protests by locals following reports of ill-treatment of Afghan refugees in Iran. Earlier, Iran's embassy in Kabul had called such reports a foreign conspiracy aimed at disturbing the bilateral relations between the two countries.

371.title: Marathi actors are paid less in Hindi TV industry: Actor Prasad Oak
371.article_body: Actor-director Prasad Oak said in an interview that he is "happy with...Marathi industry" and has no desire to work in the Hindi television industry. "On Hindi television, Marathi performers get paid less," he added. "I thought, why so much disparity...Comparatively, I was getting more money from Marathi shows than Hindi shows. Why should I keep myself economically low?" Prasad said.

372.title: Babar is the Brian Lara, Don Bradman of this era: Ex-Pak captain Latif
372.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said Pakistan captain Babar Azam is the Don Bradman and Brian Lara of this era. Talking about comparisons between Virat Kohli and Sachin Tendulkar, Latif stated, "For doing that, you have to analyse a lot of things. Umpiring, DRS..., pitches, bats, balls used, ground dimensions. The game has changed a lot."

373.title: Bengal police acting as TMC polling agents: BJP's Malviya on bypolls
373.article_body: Amid ongoing Lok Sabha and Assembly bypolls in West Bengal, BJP's Amit Malviya alleged on Tuesday that the state police were acting as "polling agents" for Trinamool Congress (TMC). He further alleged that the media was denied access to cover the polling. Malviya's comments came after BJP's Agnimitra Paul alleged that TMC workers hurled stones at her convoy in Asansol.

374.title: I had perinatal depression, it's horrible: Britney while announcing 3rd pregnancy
374.article_body: American pop singer Britney Spears, while announcing that she's pregnant with her third child, opened up about facing perinatal depression during a previous pregnancy. "It's absolutely horrible...women didn't talk about it back then...some people considered it dangerous if a woman complained like that with a baby inside her...but now women talk about it every day," said 40-year-old Spears.

375.title: Orange wristbands issued to team by Ranbir-Alia's wedding planners for security: Report
375.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's reported wedding planners have issued special orange-coloured wristbands to all their team members, as per a report. This is to avoid breaches and to ensure there is no leak of photos and videos, the report added. The bands reportedly have tags encoded on them to give the team members access to key points.

376.title: Leave IPL for a week and join protests: Ranatunga to SL cricketers amid economic crisis
376.article_body: Former Sri Lanka captain Arjuna Ranatunga has urged Sri Lankan cricketers playing in IPL to leave the tournament for a week and join protests in the country amid economic crisis. "There are some cricketers who are lavishly playing in IPL and haven't spoken about their country. Unfortunately, people are scared to speak against the government," he said.

377.title: He said 'Bapu, tu aaya aur mujhe le gaya': Axar Patel on Dhoni's retirement from Tests
377.article_body: Recalling MS Dhoni announcing his retirement from Tests during India's tour of Australia in 2014, Axar Patel, who had received his maiden Test call-up at the time, said, "Dhoni jokingly told me, 'Bapu...tu aaya aur mujhe le gaya'." Axar added he got teary-eyed after Dhoni announced his decision to retire. Axar also revealed Suresh Raina broke down following the announcement.

378.title: SC stays Congress leader Hardik Patel's conviction in 2015 riot case
378.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday stayed the conviction of Congress leader Hardik Patel in a 2015 riot case amid the Patidar agitation in Gujarat. "We are of the view that this is the fit case for the high court to have stayed the conviction. The conviction is, hereby, stayed until the appeals are decided accordingly," SC said.

379.title: They always turn things around: Hogg on CSK's worst start to IPL season
379.article_body: Ex-KKR spinner Brad Hogg said CSK cannot be written off in IPL 2022 despite recording their worst start in an IPL season, as they always turn things around. "CSK...[will] have to re-establish themselves, reset and look at different options in the bowling and batting department," added Hogg. CSK have lost all four IPL 2022 matches played so far.

380.title: Over 8 lakh pilgrims expected at this year's Amarnath Yatra: Officials
380.article_body: Amarnath Yatra this year "will be historic" and "twice in size" than before, with the Jammu and Kashmir administration preparing to welcome about 8 lakh pilgrims to the cave shrine in south Kashmir Himalayas, officials said. All arrangements will be done for security, an official added. Amarnath Yatra was not conducted in 2020 and 2021 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

381.title: Police constable caught taking ₹1.5 lakh bribe in Gurugram
381.article_body: A police constable was caught taking ₹1.5 lakh as a bribe in Gurugram, an official said on Monday. The constable had demanded the bribe to help two men held in a fraud case, the official added. The arrest was made after a relative of one of the accused had filed a complaint against the constable at the Rohtak Vigilance Department.

382.title: Former Jammu & Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti placed under house arrest
382.article_body: Authorities placed former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti under house arrest in Srinagar on Tuesday to prevent her from going to Anantnag district. Mufti claimed that she intended to visit the family of a Kashmiri Pandit who was attacked in Shopian. "Government of India wilfully spreads fake propaganda about Kashmiri mainstream and muslims responsible for pandit exodus," she added.

383.title: Indian Oil removes Russian Urals from its latest tender: Report
383.article_body: Indian Oil Corp (IOC) excluded several high-sulfur crude grades, including Russian Urals, from its latest tender closing on Tuesday, Reuters reported. It reportedly informed market participants that Das, Eugene Island, Thunder Horse and Urals crude were no longer on the list of grades under its latest tender. IOC imports crude for itself and on behalf of its Chennai Petroleum subsidiary.

384.title: Karthik is the most dangerous player for cameos in T20s: Manjrekar
384.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said he has always believed that RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik is the most dangerous player for cameos in T20 cricket. Talking about former RCB captain Virat Kohli, Manjrekar stated that Kohli's power game has diminished. "Once his power game gets better, then I will say Kohli has arrived in T20 cricket," said Manjrekar.

385.title: B'desh pacer Khaled Ahmed fined 15% of match fee for throwing ball at SA batter
385.article_body: Bangladesh pacer Khaled Ahmed has been fined 15 per cent of his match fee after he threw the ball towards South Africa batter Kyle Verreynne, hitting him on the right glove during their second Test. Khaled was found guilty of breaching the ICC Code of Conduct and one demerit point was also added to his disciplinary record.

386.title: Govt should run bulldozer on problems of people: Rahul Gandhi
386.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that the government should "run a bulldozer" on issues like inflation and unemployment. "Inflation and unemployment have exhausted the people of the country," Gandhi tweeted. "The government should run a bulldozer on these problems but there’s hatred and panic on BJP’s bulldozer," he added.

387.title: Former Japanese princess working as unpaid volunteer at US museum: Reports
387.article_body: Japan's former Princess Mako is now an unpaid volunteer at New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art after giving up her titles to marry a commoner, according to reports. Mako moved to the US in November 2021, one month after marrying Kei Komuro, her college boyfriend who works at a law firm in the city.

388.title: CSK have a lot of question marks: Parthiv ahead of CSK vs RCB
388.article_body: Talking about defending champions CSK, who are winless in IPL 2022 so far, Parthiv Patel said there are a lot of question marks whether it's about their bowling combination or batting. "They've Robin Uthappa...Ambati Rayudu, but Ruturaj Gaikwad's form has drastically changed...they've made a big change with Ravindra Jadeja as captain," he added. CSK will face RCB today.

389.title: Taiwan iPhone maker Pegatron suspends ops at China plants amid COVID-19
389.article_body: Taiwan's Pegatron, which assembles iPhones, has suspended operations at its Shanghai and Kunshan plants amid the government's measures against COVID-19. The resumption of work depends on the two plants being given clearance by the government. It will also maintain close contact with customers and suppliers and would "actively cooperate" with local governments to resume work as soon as possible.

390.title: 2 arrested with ganja worth over ₹1.8 lakh in Thane
390.article_body: Police have arrested two people for their alleged connection with the sale of ganja in Maharashtra's Thane. Ganja worth ₹1.8 lakh was also seized from their possession, police said on Tuesday. Police are also looking for the third accused who allegedly cultivated ganja in Shirpur of Maharashtra's Dhule district, an official said.

391.title: Rachakonda Police bust fake land documents racket, 9 gang members held
391.article_body: The Rachakonda Police on Monday busted a fake land documents racket and apprehended nine people. According to police, the gang members used to target vacant lands not claimed by original land owners for a long time. Police also recovered 10 fake sale deed documents, forged government stamps, fake ID cards, 10 cell phones and over ₹10 lakh cash from them.

392.title: Andhra CM announces ₹2 lakh ex gratia for families of train accident victims
392.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has announced ₹2 lakh ex gratia for the families of each of the five passengers who were killed when Konark Express ran over them in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam. According to the district collector, two of the deceased were identified as residents of Assam while the remaining ones are yet to be identified.

393.title: Over 50% of global population suffers from headaches: Study
393.article_body: According to research, 52% of the global population is affected by headache disorder every year with 14% of them reporting migraine. As per research, headaches, especially migraines were more common in females (17%) than males (8.6%). Headaches that last for 15 or more days per month were seen in 6% of females as compared to 2.9% of males.

394.title: My parents considered me playing cricket like a crime: RCB's Akash Deep
394.article_body: RCB pacer Akash Deep said his parents used to consider him playing cricket as equal to a crime, adding that his father was sceptical about his future. "There was a reason for that as whoever from that region played cricket didn't make it big in life," added Akash. "I used to sneak out and play cricket," stated Akash.

395.title: Kohli got out on low pitches while Sachin would never be dismissed: Latif
395.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said Sachin Tendulkar would never get dismissed on low pitches, whereas Virat Kohli got out when batting on such pitches during India's recent Test series against Sri Lanka. "That is the fault in [Kohli's batting]," added Latif. "On poor pitches, there is no batsman better than Sachin," stated Latif.

396.title: Nadal skips Barcelona Open, comeback date remains uncertain
396.article_body: 21-times Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal has decided to skip this month's Barcelona Open as he is yet to recover from a rib injury. "Rafa has just been withdrawn from the entry list in Barcelona," the Spaniard's team said in a statement. "We don't know yet when he will be at his first tournament on clay this year," they added.

397.title: China approves 1st batch of new video game licenses in 9 months
397.article_body: China approved new video game licenses on Monday for the first time in nine months. The country had last approved games in July 2021, in which 87 games had received licenses. This time 45 new titles were granted licenses. Of the 45 titles, not a single one is from the big domestic leaders NetEase and Tencent Holdings, media reports said.

398.title: UN recognises Hyd as '2021 Tree City of the World' for 2nd straight year
398.article_body: For a second consecutive year, Hyderabad has been jointly recognised as the '2021 Tree City of the World' by the United Nations' Food and Agriculture Organisation and Arbor Day Foundation. According to the organisation, 3,50,56,635 trees were planted in the city with 500 volunteer hours. Reacting to the same, Telangana special chief secretary Arvind Kumar tweeted, "Matter of immense pride."

399.title: Indonesia parliament passes landmark Bill against sexual violence
399.article_body: Indonesia's parliament has passed a landmark Bill aimed at tackling sexual violence cases. According to the final draft of the Bill, crimes of physical sexual abuse will attract 12 years imprisonment, while there will be 15 years jail term for sexual exploitation. It also includes nine years jail for forced marriage and four years for circulating non-consensual sexual content.

400.title: India ready to supply food stock to world if WTO allows: PM Modi
400.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that during a virtual meeting with US President Joe Biden on Monday, he suggested to supply food stock to the world if the World Trade Organisation allows it. While addressing an event in Gujarat online, PM Modi added that food stock in different parts of the world is dwindling due to the Russia-Ukraine war.

401.title: Ayushmann's 'Anek' release postponed, film to now release on May 27
401.article_body: The release of 'Anek', starring Ayushmann Khurrana, has been postponed. The action thriller film, which was initially set to release on May 13, will now hit the screens on May 27. The makers shared a poster of the film on Tuesday, revealing the new release date of the film. 'Anek' has been directed by Anubhav Sinha.
